direction.raw_text: ! SHE GOT ENOUGH! The quaking slows to an occasional lurch but Paul does not stop whipping the table around until everything it is absolutely still. He leans against the wall, panting. Sethe is crouched by the stove. A mixed expression of relief and guilt - the expression of a mother whose disobedient child has been sent away. But a child she loves nonetheless. Denver looks frightened. More alone than ever, now that her one companion is gone. All three are breathing together as if to the same beat, like one tired person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. KITCHEN - LATER THAT DAY.. Denver walks through the broken furniture and dishes. At the stove, she ashes over the fire and pulls the pan of biscuits from the oven, EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - CONTINUOUS. A shirtless Paul D. is by the water pump washing himself. INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS. Denver lifts the fallen jelly cupboard, it's contents laying in a heap in the corner of the bottom shelf. She takes out a jar. She looks for a plate and finds half of one by the broken table. She picks it up as she hears Paul enter through the front door. INT. BABY SUGGS BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS. Sethe prepares a bed for Paul. Baby Suggs quilt is on the bed. She hesitates whether or not to leave it there. Paul stands by the door with his shoes in his bands, his shirt hanging open down the front. Sethe is surprised to see him there - she feels awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you...take a rest..I'll call you when we're ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you don't want me to help clean up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No..you'd just get in my way. Denver and me'll do it. They stand in silence, looking at each other for a moment. The awkwardness they both feel strike them suddenly as funny. Paul starts smiling. Sethe covers her mouth to conceal it. And then, just as quickly, the urge to laugh subsides - and the fear they feel takes it's place. Paul slowly closes the door and places his shoes on the floor. Sethe watches him. Paul crosses to her. He moves in to kiss her. They approach each other's lips like two burn victims, trying desperately not to hurt the other with their touch. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - CONTINUOUS. Denver sits on the porch steps, alone once again. Miserably eating the biscuit and jelly off of a half broken plate. INT. BABY SUGGS BEDROOM - MINUTES LATER. Sethe and Paul lay in bed, after lovemaking. They are still fully clothed. The lovemaking was fast and finished quickly. Now, there is an awkwardness that is without humor or excitement - but sits like a chasm between them. As Sethe lays there, SHE REMEMBERS: MEMORY: EXT. THE CORN FIELDS OF SWEET HOME - A DAY REMEMBERED. A brilliant bright yellow and green corn stalks in a tiny corn field. Sethe and a slightly older HALLE - handsome, strong - run through the field until Halle stops them at an isolated spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here?! out in the open?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look around - can you see anybody? Sethe looks and can see nothing through the corn stalks. She shakes her head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then nothing can see us neither. He takes off his shirt. Seethe giggles as she gets on the ground, keeping her ankles crossed. Halle lays her back and gently separates her legs. She giggles. Halle pauses before laying on top of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a beautiful sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my wife now! I can talk as stupid as I like about you! (she giggles) I ain't never loved nothing like you before, Sethe. (Sethe is moved) And after I get mama out...then I get us out too. And you'll see, baby girl... (smiles) we're gonna have us a liiife.. He sings the word "life", so that Sethe laughs. Then, Halle lowers himself slowly to her and they begin to make love. As camera pans up to a HILL above the field, we hear Sethe ask;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure nobody can see? We hear Halle grunt "uh-huh" as we arrive on the hill where a GREAT TREE sits. EXT. GREAT TREE ON THE HILL - DAY. Beneath the tree, PAUL D, SIXO and Paul's brothers Paul A. and Paul P. are pouring water over heads and watching; POV; Unbeknownst to Halle and Sethe, their lovemaking is in clear view to anyone on the hill...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. I don't get why she picked him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halle's got that way about him. That way a woman feels he's doing it all for her, not for himself at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't see nothing so special about Halle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about what he's doing for his mama?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fool thing, if you ask me. By the time he buys it, freedom won't mean a thing to somebody that old and worn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freedom mean something anytime it come. The men watch the corn stalks swaying to the lovemaking. A YOUNG PAUL D., in particular, watches with tender yearning. INT. KITCHEN AT SWEET HOME - EARLY EVENING. MR. GARNER, the man who owns and runs Sweet Home. He offers cooked corn to the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raccoon must've got into my corn. Damaged a few so, no use throwing them out... The men looks to each other, suppressing a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe, get the butter there. Everyone looks at each other as they thank No. Garner and begin to smear butter on their corn and eat. A NEIGHBORING FARMER visiting the Garner's cautions him;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spoil these nigger boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you got boys on your farm. My nigger's are men. Not a boy among'em. Bought 'em thataway, raised'em thataway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beg to differ Garner. Ain't no nigger men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if you scared. But if you a man yourself, you'll want your niggers to be men too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't have no nigger men around my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither would I..Neither would I. Sethe hides a smile as she hands a piece of corn to Halle. Paul A and Paul F hesitate as they think of eating the corn which the lovers consummated. But Sixo digs right in. Paul D eats slowly, his eyes never leaving Sethe as she moves Around the kitchen, her eyes never leaving Halle...Paul's Attraction and love for her are apparent. END OF MEMORY; INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - EARLY EVENING. C.U. on PAUL, on his back, turned away from Sethe. What began as Sethe's memory, has blended into Paul's. Sethe rises off the bed, breaking the thick silence between them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you when there's something to eat. She exits, leaving Paul alone on the bed. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - THE FOLLOWING DAY. We see the house now. No creaking or sounds of breaking furniture. Just the sound of Paul D. singing. INT. KITCHEN - DAY. Paul is singing as he fixes the table he broke while driving the baby ghost away. Denver is sweeping the floor - irritated by Paul's presence and voice. They both hear the front door open as Sethe arrives home from work. They look to each other to see which one will make a move for Sethe first. Paul knows enough to bide his time with Denver. He watches as she places the broom down and exits the kitchen. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - NIGHT. Paul and Sethe sit on the porch together. Sethe is sewing. Paul nervously gets up his nerve to ask:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe. (she stops and looks) I was thinking of looking for work around here. What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't much. River mostly. And hogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hogs is fine. Paul moves to where Sethe is sitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need much, Sethe. Eat, sleep, sing a little when it strikes me. I don't ask for more to..to live somewhere. Sethe realizes what he is asking and tentatively responds:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. It's...it's fine with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your girl Denver. Seems she's of a different mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about her. She's a charmed child. Nothing ever touch her too bad. From the beginning. Everybody I knew dead or gone, but not her. (pause) You got to know something, though - this here ain't no better life. It's just not that other one. What I do here - all I ever do - is keep Denver from that other..So if you stay, there's no more talk about Sweet Home or anything else. I won't let the past in my yard again. Getting me and Denver through this here life is all that matters. You understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dangerous to love anything that much, Sethe. Best thing is to love everything just a little bit..that way, when it breaks or runs off or gets taken, well maybe you'd have a little love left over for the next one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be asking me to choose, Paul D. There ain't no choice here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the whole point. I'm not asking you to choose. Just want to know if there's some space for me. Want to know if it's more than "you can stay", "it's fine"..more like, "I want you here Paul". Beat. Sethe is frightened by the prospect of feeling for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should leave things the way they are. Sethe rises to enter the house when Paul's words stop her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about inside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe, if I'm here with you, with Denver, you can go anywhere you want. Jump, if you want to, 'cause I'll catch you. Go as far inside as you need - I'll hold your ankles. Make sure you get back out. I'm not saying this because I need a place to stay. I told you, I'm a walking man, but I been heading in this direction for seven years. When I got here and sat out there on the porch, waiting for you, well, I knew it wasn't the place I was heading toward. It was you. We can make a life girl. A life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave it to me. See how it goes. No promises, if you don't want to make any. Just see how it goes, all right? Sethe's heart is twisted. She wants to cry...because she feels hope...and because she feels fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. We'll see how it goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You willing to leave it to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well..some of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some?...Well okay...some. Sethe manages a smile. INT. DENVER'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Denver lies curled up in her bed. Alone. Sethe enters and crawls in unexpectedly. Denver looks up, surprised to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Nothing's wrong. Lay back down. Denver obeys, unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think baby ghost's really gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss her. Sethe lets out a small laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. Baby Suggs told me baby ghost would never hurt me. She was my sister. When I was little, after the boys left, I used to think that she and me both were waiting for daddy to come. And once he did, she wouldn't be mad no more. (Sethe listens sadly) They hear Paul singing out on the porch. Denver grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wish he'd shut-up...He's ruined everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he hasn't. He won't. (hesitates) He..he wants to takes us to the carnival next Thursday... Denver's eyes light up with excitement then caution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, go out where they'll be other people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dress up a little bit. Wear our hats. What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe...All right...all right. (difficult for her to say) Can I ask you something? (Denver nods, her back to Sethe) I was wondrin'..What you think about us...maybe... maybe thinking we could start...if we got an idea to, thinking we could start.. countin' on... (she stops)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On what mama? Countin' on what? Sethe can barely bring herself to say. To hope. To imagine. Paul? But, for Denver, she forces herself and whispers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something. EXT. CARNIVAL - DAY. Paul and Sethe and Denver walk among the hundreds of black townspeople gathered for the carnival. A sign reads COLORED THURSDAY...TWO PENNIES ENTRANCE FEE. Paul is in high spirits. Saying hello to anyone whose eye he catches. Willing, eager to get anything for Denver she wants. Feeling a little more like a normal van in a normal life. Denver is excited but worried. She doesn't want to like Paul but can't help the thrill she's feeling. And when one or two passersby shout out;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Denver!...Hi there Denver! Denver heart almost weeps with joy. Sethe walks cautiously. Overdressed for the occasion, it is her first outing among neighborhood folk in many years. She catches the eyes of some of the women she knows...ELLA and LADY JONES..good Christian women who nod in their acknowledgement yet are holding back something. A judgement? A repulsion? Paul doesn't notice them and for this Sethe is glad. MONTAGE of SCENES...the various carnival acts, all performed by a WHITE TROUPE; magic, clowning, fire swallowing, spitting ribbons, acrobats forming pyramids... Our trio take it all in like water to the thirsty. At one point, A WHITE CARNIVAL BARKER shouts to the children;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All Pickaninnies free!! The phrase stabs Sethe and Paul a bit. But Paul whispers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two pennies and an insult well spent in my opinion to see the spectacle of whitefolks making a spectacle of themselves. Sethe can't help but let out a small laugh - and with that laugh, a sudden sensation of relief... Paul buys Denver some licorice, peppermint and lemonade. Holding the lemonade for her, Paul asks;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mind if I take a sip? Denver agrees. Paul takes some lemonade then wipes the rim where he sipped with a small napkin and gently hands it back to her. Denver, in spite of herself, is starting to like him. END MONTAGE. EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY. Our trio are leaving the carnival, walking three astride with distance in between each. The sunlight casts strong shadows. Sethe's eyes glance towards the ground behind them and sees; THEIR THREE SHADOWS ARE HOLDING HANDS.....as they walk home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; FADE- IN. EXT. A STREAM AND THE BANK BESIDE IT - DAY. WIDE ANGLE of a BEAUTIFUL, WIDE STREAM (more like a small river) with a MULBERRY TREE standing tall on the bank before it. There is not a soul in sight as the stream moves gracefully beneath the sun. SUDDENLY; A FULLY DRESSED YOUNG BLACK WOMAN EMERGES FROM THE MIDDLE OF THE STREAM LIKE A GODDESS ARISING OUT OF SPIRITUAL WATERS... SHE WEARS A STRAW HATT A WHITE DRESS WITH BUTTONS, A LACE COLLAR AND NEW SHOES. SHE WALKS OUT OF THE WATER TO THE BANK. Exhausted, sopping wet and breathing heavily as if from asthma, she sits, leaning against the mulberry tree. She seems too tired to even hold her head upon her neck. Yet her skin is like new lineless and smooth. Glowing. Although racked with pain, SHE IS SMILING. Smiling the way travellers smile when they have finally arrived after a long and arduous journey. EXT. WOODS - DAY. The Young Black Woman makes her way through the woods. She passes by Denver's BOXWOOD BUSH secret place. Then continues forward, as if with a specific direction in mind. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE ROAD - LATE AFTERNOON. Sethe, Paul and Denver approach 124. Denver is the first to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. What is that? All three look to see; THE YOUNG BLACK WOMAN sitting on a stump not far from the steps of 124. As the three approach, the Young Woman lifts her head and stares directly at Sethe. The two women exchange a moment in their eyes - Sethe, curious yet warm...The Young Woman, happy yet there is a hunger in her stare. INT. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER. The Young Woman seated on a chair as Denver refills a tin cup of water. The Young Woman drinks greedily, cup after cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You from around here? The Young Woman shakes her head NO. She reaches down and takes off her shoes, which Sethe notices as new. Sethe bends down to pick them up. The Young Woman never lets her eyes leave Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those shoes look brand new.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What might your name be? The Young Woman speaks in a low, rough voice;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved. Sethe drops the shoes. Denver sits down. Paul smiles;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved. You use a last name, Beloved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last. No..just Beloved.. (she spells it) B..E..L..O..V..E..D... As she spells it we see sethe's reaction; she is deeply touched. Then Denver's - who looks both amazed and curiously excited. Sethe hangs her own hat on a peg then approaches Beloved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a pretty name Beloved. Take off your hat and I'll make us something. We just got back from the carnival over near Cincinnati- But Beloved has fallen asleep upright in the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss...Miss, you want to lay down? Her eyes open to slits. Paul is about to help her when Denver rises;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take her up. She can sleep in baby Suggs room - that all right Mama?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course. Denver eases Beloved onto her feet, which Sethe and Paul notice do not have a line or sore on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at her feet? They're not walking feet. More like she rode from somewhere all the way here. Yet, Beloved can barely stand upon them as Denver escorts her to the white staircase. Beloved starts coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like the croup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she feverish, Denver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She's cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she is. Fever goes from hot to cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could have the cholera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not sick! Denver helps her up the stairs. Sethe and Paul register Denver's defensive reaction. INT. BABY SUGG'S ROOM - SAME TIME. Denver eases Beloved into the bed. Beloved falls asleep the second she hits the pillow. Denver gently - cautiously - strokes Beloved's forehead and cheek. INT. BABY SUGG'S ROOM - NIGHT. Denver stands vigil beside Beloved, wrapped beneath a quilt. INT. BABY SUGG'S ROOM - THE FOLLOWING DAY. Denver watches her sleep, wiping her hot forehead with cold cloths... INT. BABY'S SUGG'S ROOM - NIGHT. Denver washes out Beloved's underwear and stockings...She hears Beloved murmuring. She moves quickly to her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved? Beloved I'm here...what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heavy..this place is heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to sit up? Beloved shakes her head no. She takes hold of Denver's arm and wraps it around her own body. Denver sits up against the pillow as Beloved snuggles her body into Denver's arms and falls back asleep. Denver holds her, lovingly. INT. BABY SUGGS ROOM - DAYS LATER. Denver has not left her bedside. She places another quilt upon her, tucking it in around the sides. As she does this, Beloved's eyes open for a brief moment, catching the sight of Denver over her. She smiles. Denver gratefully smiles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get you anything? Are you hungry? Beloved looks over to a plate of half finished food - Denver's meal. Denver picks up a piece of sweet bread and feeds her. Denver is thrilled. THE FOLLOWING SCENES TAKE PLACE OVER SEVERAL WEEKS; INT. KITCHEN - THE NEXT DAY. Denver places sugar between two pieces of bread and gives the sandwich to Beloved, who, no longer feeling sickly, accepts it with a bright smile. EXT. HEN HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY. Denver explains how to pack mud in the cracks of the hen house as Beloved listens attentively, eating jelly out of a jar. INT. HEN HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY. Denver explains to Beloved how to warm the chicks with their skirts as the latter eats something sweet. They both giggle at the softness of the chicks. INT. DENVER & BELOVED'S BEDROOM - ANOTHER DAY. Denver is showing Beloved how to make her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..then you fold it over like this see. This here used to be where my brothers and me slept. I was always at the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you get so smart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't so smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I used to go to Lady Jones. She'd teach us with songs how to spell and count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't go no more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I...I had to stop going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You so smart. Tell me about your brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well..they're names were Howard and.. As Denver continues, Beloved steps towards her and begins to touch her face - examining her lips, her nose, her skin as if it were a rose to admire. Denver drinks in the attention, her heart expanding with love with every touch from this strange creature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..and....and Bulgar...At night, we used to..crawl into bed together..I'd lay down on Bul's lap and Howard would tell us die- witch stories. He said they would protect us...And if I learned them, they would protect me if ever they were gone... EXT. PORCH - EARLY EVENING. Everyone is sitting on the porch after dinner. Beloved, looking strong and fit, eats a cane stick - gnawing at it to the flax, keeping the strings in her mouth long after the syrup had been sucked off. It makes Denver laugh, as she licks her cane stick. It makes Sethe smile, to see them both happy. It makes Paul disgusted. INT. KEEPING ROOM - NIGHT. Paul confronts Sethe as she sews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna just feed her, from now on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denver likes her. She's no real trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But don't she have a home? Some place to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't mention one. I thought we'd wait until her breathing got better. She still sounds a little lumbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She breathe like she can eat, she could blow this whole house down. And all those sweets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes the body needs that sugar for strength when it's trying to recover after an illness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's just it. She don't seem sick. Something funny about her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny? How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acts sick, sounds sick but she don't look sick. Good skin, bright hands and strong as a bull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can hardly walk without holding onto something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I mean. Can't walk but I passed by Baby Sugg's room this morning and saw her lifting the rocker with one hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me. Ask Denver. She was right there. At that moment, Denver passes by on her way to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denver. Come in here a minute. Denver enters the keeping room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul says you saw Beloved pick up the rocking chair in Baby Suggs room with one hand. That so? Denver looks at Paul with a hard gaze;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't see no such thing. From Paul's expression we can tell Denver is lying...and whatever fragile connection they were building, is swiftly destroyed. INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Sethe is getting ready for bed. Denver sticks her head in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen her? I can't find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved. Sethe shakes her head. Denver exits anxiously. The mentions of Beloved's name stir a MEMORY in Sethe: MEMORY: EXT. GRAVESTONE YARD - A DAY REMEMBERED. Sethe talks to the HEADSTONE ENGRAVER as he works in the hot sun. His YOUNG SON helps him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She need a marker. Somethin' to tell me where she is. But I ain't got no money. The Engraver eyes her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got then? Sethe is embarrassed by his lascivious tone, especially in front of the young boy. The Engraver rises, takes a step toward Sethe and touches her hip, curling his hand around to her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want it to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking what the preacher say at the funeral. Dearly Beloved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For ten minutes I give you one word for free. His hand glides down to her buttocks. Sethe can't help but see the Young Boy watching the scene. END of MEMORY. INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. As the memory starts to fade form her mind, Sethe suddenly feels someone else's presence. She looks up to find: Beloved standing by the door - watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh!...I didn't know you were there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help what, honey? Beloved kneels before her on the floor and finishes buttoning up Sethe's night dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you go in the morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work. I work in a restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little after the sun come up. I like to make a loaf of bread before I go. How you feelin'? Beloved nods, absorbing the information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember your mother at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember a woman who was mine and I remember bein snatched away from her. Sethe, nods, understanding such things. She cautiously reaches out to stroke Beloved's face. Beloved responds like a puppy, pressing her cheek against Sethe's hand. Sethe is moved. INT. KITCHEN - PRE DAWN. Sethe enters the kitchen to make bread before she leaves for work. She finds Beloved waiting for her, placing out her cooking things on the table. Beloved looks up and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm helpin make your bread. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE - EARLY EVENING. Beloved waits anxiously at the window for the sight of Sethe coming home from work.... When she sees her, she runs through the house, out the door to meet her. Denver appears at the door, upset by Beloved's loss of attention in her. EXT. PORCH - EVENING. C.U. - SETHE, as she leans her tired head against the porch, sitting on the step. She closes her eyes and is about to drift off, when; BELOVED'S HAND gently touches her shoulder, settling there. Sethe looks up and smiles, patting her hand. Beloved stands above her as Denver takes a seat on the step. Beloved searches Sethe's eyes and asks;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where your diamonds? The question surprises Sethe...and startles Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diamonds? What would I be doing with diamonds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wish I did. (beat) Hmm..come to think of it, I had some crystal once. A present from Mrs. Garner - woman I worked for at Sweet Home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw you with no earrings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone. Long gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me...Tell me about your diamonds... Sethe hesitates. Beloved kneels at her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am don't talk about Sweet Home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me...Tell me about your diamonds. Denver awaits her mother's reaction with great interest. Sethe looks at Beloved sweet, innocent expression and something in her resistance, eases:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well..this lady I worked for in Kentucky gave them to me when I got married.. Denver is both interested and slightly hurt at her mother's willingness to tell Beloved what she'd never tell her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..What they called married back then. I remember going up to her in the kitchen to tell her. I'd help her make ink for Mr. Garner in the kitchen. I was fool enough to think I was going have some kind of ceremony...maybe even a new dress.. (CONTINUES AS WE CUT TO;) Sethe's continues telling Beloved, an attentive audience... Denver, more attuned to Beloved's interest than the story, is disturbed at her mother's telling of it. INT. KITCHEN - ANOTHER EVENING. Camera moves up from the mended legs of the table Paul broke to; A suspicious Paul glares at Beloved as they eat dinner. Beloved is ever ready to pass Sethe a bowl or napkin or whatever she needs. She is "shining" - for Sethe, and for Sethe alone. Denver notices it as well. It is raining outside. Both Denver and Beloved are wet from the rain. Denver's hair is all tangled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best unbraid that hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today's always here. Tomorrow never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It hurts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comb it everyday, it won't..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your woman never fixed up your hair? All three look to Beloved, puzzled by her question, which is clearly intended for Sethe. Paul's getting more annoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My woman?..You mean my mother? Beloved nods. Paul and Denver exchange a curious look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she did I don't remember. I don't think I saw her but a few times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me 'bout her. Paul and Denver look to Sethe, waiting to see if she'll answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..I remember once, she picked me up and carried me behind the smokehouse... The only thing I do remember in fact... Paul is disturbed by Sethe's carefree storytelling - how it contradicts her words to him that first day and worried it will lead to no good... Once again, Denver is surprised to hear what she's never heard before. She looks to Paul and knows what he is thinking. Paul looks back and knows Denver realizes it. But Denver returns his glance with a defensive dismissal of the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...She opened up her dress and right on her rib, right here, was a circle and a cross burnt right into the skin....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Paul doesn't want her to continue but doesn't want to say so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any more beans? Sethe rises to get him more food and she continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...anyway, she points to this mark and says to me "This is your ma'am. I am the only one whose got this mark now. The rest all dead. If something happens to me and you can't tell me by my face, you can know me by this mark"..Scared me so... I couldn't think of anything to say so I said "Yes Ma'am..but how will you know us? Mark me too. Mark the mark on me too."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She slapped my face. I didn't understand it then. Not until I had a mark of my own... Paul is disturbed. He can see Sethe getting upset. He is mad at Beloved for her damn questions..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to her? Something inside of Sethe stops, a wall erected. Something unwanted is coming into her consciousness. Paul notices it. She rises;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. Everybody done? Sethe collects a few dishes and crosses to the sink as Paul asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, as long as we're all asking questions, getting to know each other.. (to Beloved) Why don't you tell us a little bit about yourself? Camera follows Sethe as she arrives at the sink, placing the dish inside. We hear the others O.S.:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She don't remember nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You be surprised what you start remembering once you start talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have some more pudding? Camera stays on Sethe as we drown out the voices at the kitchen table. She is staring out the window above the sink as if watching the MEMORY BEING RELIVED IN HER YARD; POV - OUT THE WINDOW; MEMORY: EXT. A LARGE TREE IN A FIELD - A DAY REMEMBERED. A CROWD of people surround a tree. SEVERAL WHITE MEN are preparing to hang a group of black men and women standing in line, awaiting their turn. Among the crowd is A CHILD (SETHE) holding the hand of an OLDER BLACK SLAVE WOMAN (NAN). Nan is pointing to a WOMAN (SETHE'S MOTHER), who is one of the people waiting in line to be hanged. Nan whispers to Sethe:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your mama - right there. Little Sethe looks up and sees her mother - her face a mask of courage and rage and tears. She looks straight ahead - not at anyone in particular, especially not her daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..I'm telling you, small girl Sethe...Me and your Mama was taken by the men many times..She threw them other babies away..the others from the whites, without names, she threw them away..But you she gave the name of the black man. She had her arms around him, child. The others, she did not put her arms around. Never...Never... The child Sethe listens, watching her mother move further down the line. END of MEMORY as WE CUT BACK TO: INT. KITCHEN - Sethe, the memory passing, hears the voices in her kitchen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't you got no brothers or sisters?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have nobody. She finds Paul interrogating Beloved who eats a second pudding. Denver tries to interfere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has us now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been here five weeks, we still don't know nothing bout you..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, Stop it. Denver bring those dishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was you looking for when you came here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place. I was looking for this place I could be in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody tell you about this place? At the sink, both Sethe and Denver pause, obviously interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She told me. When I was at the bridge, she told me. Paul looks quizzically at Sethe, who shrugs;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be somebody from the old days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you come? Who brought you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I walked here. A long, long, long, long way. Nobody bring me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had new shoes. If you walked so long why don't your shoes show it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul D. stop picking on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know! Where'd you get them shoes and that dress you had on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take the shoes! (coughs) I take the dress! (coughs) The shoe strings don't fit! I... Suddenly, she begins to CHOKE on a raisin from the pudding and falls backward, off the chair. Denver and Sethe rush towards her. Beloved thrashes around until they help her turn over and spit up the raisin. She breathes in Sethe's arms as Denver wipes up the mess, glaring at Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to go to sleep now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to my room. I can watch out for you up there. Sethe gets Beloved to her feet. Denver takes her up the staircase to her room - glaring at Paul. When the girls have gone, Sethe turns on Paul as she cleans up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand what the hold is. It's clear why she holds onto you, but I just can't see why you holding on to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you care who's holding on to who? Feeding her is no trouble. And she's nice company for Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We was just starting to feel a little like a family ourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what's got your teeth on edge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't place it. It's a feeling in me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna feel somethin!? ... Feel how it is to have a bed to sleep in and somebody there not worrying you to death about what you got to do each day to deserve it. And if that don't get it, feel how it feels to be a colored woman roaming the roads with anything God made liable to jump on you. Feel that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know every bit of that, Sethe. I wasn't born yesterday and I never mistreated a woman in my life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that makes one of you in this world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One? Not two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not two!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Halle ever do to you? Halle stood by you. He never left you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha, what'd he leave then if not me, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know but it wasn't you. That's a fact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he did worse - he left his children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He wasn't where he said he would be! I had to pack my babies off ahead of me, on their own, so I could stay behind to look for him...Underground agent said by Sunday we had to leave.. Sunday came and he wasn't there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't get out of the loft, I expect. Forgetting himself, Paul let that slip out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loft? What loft?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one over your head... The one in the barn. Sethe stops dead cold. It's no use... The MEMORY TAKES OVER: INT. BARN - THE PAST. Violent, rapid images of Sethe being raped and beaten held down by SCHOOLTEACHER'S BOYS. Sethe, pinned down, stares up at the loft...Camera rises up... There, in the loft, hides HALLE...The expression on his face is that of a man broken in two... END of MEMORY. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. Sethe wraps her arms tightly around herself and asks;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He saw? He told you he saw?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me. The day I came here. You said they stole your milk. I never knew what messed Halle up. That was it, I guess. I seen him the day after you left. Says where you been Halle? All he says to me was "the loft". I asked him what he meant not going with you but he never answers me. But I knew was something broke him. Not one of them years of Saturdays, Sundays and nighttime extra never touched him. But whatever he saw go on in the barn that day broke him like a twig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He saw them boys do that to me and let them keep on breathing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man ain't a Goddamn ax, Sethe. Chopping, hacking, busting every Goddamn minute of the day. Things get to him. Things he can't chop down cause they inside him. The last time I saw him, I knew he was broken for good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say? Didn't you say anything to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't?! Why the hell not?! C.U. on PAUL who doesn't want to explain - or even remember - as we cut to: MEMORY: EXT. SWEET HOME - DAY. PAUL HAS A BIT IN HIS MOUTH CHAINED TO A WAGON. He is being lead away from Sweet Home with other black men, by Three white Men. The bit jerks his head back, saliva spills uncontrollably out of his mouth. His hands are chained behind him. His feet chained together at the ankles....Another chain is connected to an iron belt and stretches to a wagon. He is being lead away with forty five other prisoners...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to kill Brandywine - man Schoolteacher sold me to. Don't know what possessed me...Me and about 45 other prisoners were being walked from Kentucky to Virginia...then on to Georgia. Two places I don't ever want to see again. He is lead past the milk shed, when he sees: HALLE, alone with a crazed faraway look in his eyes, sitting by the butter churn. HALLE'S FACE IS COVERED WITH BUTTER AND CLABBER. He sticks his hands in the churn and continues to cover his face with the sticky, slippery, white substance covering his face and head, squeezing it through his hands. The White Men laugh. Paul is aching to scream out to him but the iron bit holds down his tongue. As Paul is lead past Halle, A ROOSTER named MISTER is SITTING ON A TUB in the sun shrieks with an almost arrogant glee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at Mister there... (referring to the rooster) You go tell these niggers where to go there Mister! Crow'em right outta here! Mister crows and the white men laugh. Tears of rage and humiliation stream down Paul's face. He struggles to keep a view of Halle, until he is out of sight. END OF MEMORY. EXT. PORCH. - EARLY EVENING. Paul approaches Sethe, touching her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't plan on hearing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't take it back but I can leave it alone. Sethe, instead of collapsing from the information, she seems hardened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's do that..let's leave it alone now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let it alone. Just sit down and leave it be! Yeah that would be nice. Would be even nicer to lose it altogether - if I had my choice. Halle did. Other people's brains stopped, went crazy. How sweet that would have been. Me and Halle squatting by that churn, smashing cold lumpy butter in our faces, not a care in the world..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe, don't do this..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a relief to just stop it all right there, huh?!! Close it shut! Squeeze that butter...But I had three children on their way to Ohio and nothing would have changed that! And you tell me he didn't leave me!! Sethe exits O.S. Paul is left alone on the porch until Beloved runs out of the house giggling with Denver in pursuit. As Denver passes, Paul sarcastically remarks;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess she's feeling better, huh? Denver gives him a quick, disdainful look, then continues after Beloved. The two girls run towards the woods. EXT. BOXWOOD BUSH ROOM - NIGHT. Beloved is dancing beneath a bright moon. Denver is an attentive, grateful audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you learn to dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nowhere. Look at me do this! She puts her fists on her hips and skips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you! Come on! Come on! She takes Denver's hand and places another on her shoulder. As they dance, Denver laughs harder and harder - a giddiness from the dizziness and the gratitude she feels for Beloved's attention. They spin and fall to the ground, like two lovers nestled. Beloved catches her breath as Denver asks;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you call yourself Beloved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dark my name is Beloved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it like where you were before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark. I'm small in that place. I'm like this here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you cold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hot. Nothing to breathe there. No room to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wait; then I got on the bridge. I stay there in the dark, in the daytime, in the dark in the daytime. Long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this time you were on the bridge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. After. When I got out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To see her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am's? Sethe's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Sethe. And with that, Denver takes a breath of courage to ask the question she's been longing to ask:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You my sister, ain't you? You really are. Beloved looks at her and smiles. They are so close she leans in curiously and - touching Denver's face - kisses her on the lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't leave us, will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Never. This is where I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it. I knew. First time I saw you and you said your name. And when you touched me - real gentle. And familiar. Like I'd felt that touch before. Smiling, Beloved moves to touch Denver's cheek when suddenly, Denver sits up cross legged and urges Beloved;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell mama. You musn't tell her who you really are. I don't know what she'd do! Please, you hear? Suddenly, Beloved's face turns to rage as she rises up as well;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me what to do? Don't never tell me what to do!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But..but I'm on your side. I want to protect you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's the one! She's the one I need! You can go but she's the one I have to have! Beloved abruptly drops to her knees and crawls out the boxwood bush room as Denver's pleads;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Beloved please! Don't go! I didn't do nothing! We were dancing! Don't go!.... INT. DENVER'S & BELOVED'S ROOM - DAWN THE FOLLOWING DAY. The room is still dark from the night but the sun is rising outside. Suddenly, Beloved awakens with a start. She senses something. She rises and looks out the window to see; POV; SETHE WALKING ACROSS THE FIELD. Beloved quickly grabs her clothes and exits to follow her, as Denver awakens just in time to see her go. EXT. WOODS EARLY MORNING. Sethe is dressed as if for church as she makes her way through the woods with a specific destination in mind. Soon, she comes upon; EXT. A CLEARING IN THE WOODS - EARLY MORNING. Sethe steps out of the woods and into an open clearing. A LARGE ROCK sits in the clearing like a pulpit above the pew's of grass and weeds. Sethe remembers the place as it was... She hears the VOICES OF A CROWD...a gathering of people though the clearing remains empty. She crosses to the rock and sits. Camera moves up to reveal - MEMORY: BABY SUGGS, vital and strong, standing on the rock, preaching:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not here to tell you all to clean up your lives and sin no more....I'm not here to tell you we're the blessed meek and are glorybound!...I'm here to tell you that the only grace we can have, is the grace we can imagine...And if you cannot see it, then you shall not have it... END OF MEMORY. C.U. on SETHE as she remembers Baby Suggs words, sitting alone in the clearing - the images of the past gone. EXT. WOODS - SAME TIME. Beloved has found her and watches from a hidden place... Camera moves beyond her to find; Denver, having followed Beloved, watches her from a distance. EXT. A CLEARING IN THE WOODS - EARLY MORNING. Sethe remembers Baby Suggs advice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..God lead you home... So now, lay'em down, child. Sword and shield..Don't study war no more. Lay all that mess down. Sword and shield...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lay'em down...sword and shield. Sethe weeps...She slides to the ground and holds her head to weep. She covers her head from God and cries AS SHE LETS THE MEMORIES COME..memories she can no longer fight from coming;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : SETHE'S MEMORIES; EXT. SWEET HOME - A NIGHT REMEMBERED. SETHE IS IN THE SAME BENT OVER POSITION only here, her back is exposed and she is being beaten by the Schoolteacher's boys. The BOY BEATING SETHE never stops with the whip for a second as he rants;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..OPENING YOUR MOUTH...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! YOU BETTER STOP!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...NEVER OPEN HER MOUTH 'BOUT ME AGIN.... They beat her mercilessly. EXT. FIELD - NIGHT. Sethe, tear stained, bloody and very pregnant fights her way through a corn field as she makes her escape.. Her dress hangs torn at the back - her wounds open and bleeding. Her feet already swollen and blistered. She is in agonizing pain. She moves like a figure in a nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A SERIES OF IMAGES IN WHICH WE SEE SETHE STRUGGLING THROUGH DAYS AND NIGHTS OF WALKING AND HIDING, IN VARIOUS LOCATIONS AS SHE MAKES HER WAY ACROSS THE STATE. THE FINAL IMAGE IS: EXT. ONION FIELD - DAY. Sethe falls to the ground unable to move - her contractions have started and the pain is unbearable. Her breasts are leaking on her sweat stained body. Her legs are scratched and bleeding from moving through broken twigs and rock. On her back, the tree is starting to form. She lays there waiting for death. Until a VOICE ASKS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WHO THAT BACK THERE! Sethe can not answer as she hears TWO FEET moving through the field. She clutches her pregnant stomach as if somehow she might hide it from whoever might be coming to harm her. A RAGGEDLY LOOKING WHITE GIRL with arms like cane stalks and enough hair for five heads steps through into view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look there. A nigger. If that don't beat all... Sethe can not speak for fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, you 'bout the scariest looking something I ever seen. What you doing back up here? Sethe manages to control her breath and push out the word;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running. Amy looks at Sethe's swollen, bloody flesh at the end of her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Them the feet you running on? My Jesus my...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I in Ohio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohio! Fool girl - you in Kentucky. You 'bout a thousand miles from Ohio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still in Kentucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got anything on you, gal, pass for food?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like to die I'm so hungry. Thought there might be huckleberries. That's why I come up here. You having a baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect this baby ma'am is gonna die in these wild onions. Amy doesn't know what to do with that information. So..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I got to eat something. Any stands and looks as if she's about to leave when Sethe, feeling the girl is safe, stops her with a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you on your way to, miss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boston. Get me some velvet. It's a store called Wilson. I seen pictures and they have the prettiest velvet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boston - is that far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farther than Ohio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be velvet closer by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not like in Boston. Be so pretty on me. You ever touch velvet? Or even seen it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I did, I didn't know it. What's it like? Sethe desperately wants her to stay - to not be alone. Amy kneels back down to her, curious now;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What they call you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you gonna do, just lay there and foal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't get up. Amy wipes her nose and looks up beyond Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a house back yonder. Well, not a house with people in it - more like a lean-to near the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a difference, does it? You stay here, snake might get you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he may come but I can't stand up, let alone walk...and God help me, I can't crawl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you can Lu..come on.. Amy helps Sethe turn over onto all fours. EXT. ONION FIELD - DAY...MINUTES LATER. Amy walks beside Sethe as the latter painfully crawls, taking moments to stop and let the pain go through her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Lu! You got to move faster than that. You won't get to Ohio til you ninety years old, you keep moving that ways. INT. LEAN-TO - EARLY EVENING. Amy makes a pile of leaves for Sethe to lay on and some rocks for her to put up her feet. She talks non-stop as she works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never know it to look at me but I used to be a good size. Nice arms, everything. That was before they put me in the root cellar... She eases Sethe onto the leaves then lifts her feet onto the rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Mama worked for these people here to pay for her passage but then she had me and died right after so I had to work for'em.. I was fishing off the Beaver once and a nigger floated right by me. I don't like drowned people, do you? Your feet remind me of him. All swole like. Amy props Sethe up from behind when she notices
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all bloody back here. Gal you a mess. Undo your dress - let me see. Sethe makes a tremendous effort just to turn to her side as Amy undoes her dress;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, I ain't never seen a poorer excuse for a- Amy sees Sethe's back and, for a moment, is speechless. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus...It's a tree Lu..A chokecherry tree. I had me some whippings but I don't remember nothing like this. Glad I ain't you.. what God have in mind I wonder. ...You thank your Maker I come along. Spiderwebs all I can do for you. What's in here ain't enough. I'll look outside...Maybe I ought to break them blossoms open and let the pus run.. (rises) (smiles) That you ain't dead yet Lu's a miracle. Make you a bet..You make it through the night, you make it all the way... INT. LEAN-TO - NIGHT. To Sethe's amazement, Amy begins to massage her feet and legs the pain of which causes Sethe to cry.
direction.name: direction

She sees the flatbed pass her and continues on her way. She sees; THREE COLORED PEOPLE - AN OLDER MAN and two boys - fishing. She approaches cautiously. One of the boys is the first to see her. Sethe's bloody and torn clothes and her feverish face make her quite a sight to the young boy. He taps the Old Man on the shoulder and motions for him to turn around. The Old Man takes in Sethe and instantly knows where she's been and why she's there.

direction.raw_text: : PRESENT DAY; EXT. A CLEARING IN THE WOODS - DAY Sethe is remembering these last images, she eases her own hand up to her neck - rubbing herself the way Baby Suggs did. She realizes how much she misses her...and wonder who can touch her now and help her "lay it all down". And then, quite suddenly; AN IMAGE FLASHES ACROSS HER MIND; - PAUL GENTLY EASING HIS HANDS AROUND SETHE FROM BEHIND...TENDERLY KISSING SETHE'S BACK Paul...There is Paul. Sethe realizes, as IMAGES FLASH ACROSS HER MIND'S EYE: - PAUL SITTING ON THE PORCH THE FIRST DAY HE ARRIVED. - PAUL BATTLING THE BABY GHOST. - PAUL SINGING AS HE FIXES THE KITCHEN TABLE. - SETHE WRAPPED IN PAUL'S BIG ARMS AS THEY LAY IN BED. Sethe rises from the ground, as if with a new realization. She begins to walk out of the clearing and into the woods, her pace increasing with each image.... EXT. WOODS - DAY. Sethe walks through the woods, passing Beloved unawares - who has fallen asleep by a tree. Beloved is awakened as Sethe walks by, and gets to her feet to follow. Further on, Sethe passes a sleeping Denver, who also awakens upon hearing the footsteps of her mother, followed by Beloved. Sethe walks on, unaware of them following her. EXT. FIELD OF 124 BLUESTONE - DAY. Wide angle of Sethe walking well ahead of Beloved and Denver. Sethe is walking with great purpose and energy. INT. 124 BLUESTONE ROAD - DAY. STREAM IN THE WOODS - DAY. Beloved reaches the stream and steps in. She begins to violently hit the water around her, then begins hitting her own face and head, clawing at it as if to escape from the boundaries of flesh. Suddenly she submerges herself underwater and holds herself there, as if to drown herself... She bursts out of the water, gasping for air...Slowly, her rage subsides, replaced with a calm, ruthless understanding EXT. THE FIELD OF 124 BLUESTONE RD.- DAY. Beloved is walking back toward the house. She stops. She looks back at the house to the kitchen window - knowing Paul and Sethe are in there. She approaches the kitchen window and looks in. The inhabitants eat dinner in silence. Denver awaits a look from Beloved. As Beloved passes her a bowl of peas with a smile, Denver is satisfied. Beloved then turns to Paul, offering him the bowl.

direction.raw_text: You have brothers or sisters? Caught off guard, Paul looks to Sethe - whose expression asks him to be nice.

direction.raw_text: Sethe told us you been walking for eighteen years. Where you been all that time? Paul is about to get mad when he looks to Sethe again, reels it back in and answers curtly, but politely;

direction.raw_text: Lots of places. I don't remember them all. Don't remember much about anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You be surprised what you start remembering once you start talking. Hearing his own words echoed back to him, annoys him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well not me. What's gone is gone. No good come from bringing it back. Pause. Paul focuses on his dinner, suddenly ill at ease. He can't help looking, covertly, at Beloved and finds Beloved staring right back at him...It makes him shiver. INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Sethe is asleep. Paul is restless - tossing and turning as we Intercut; Dream Images flashing across his mind... - RAIN POURING DOWN A TRENCH. A MUDDY POOL FORMING AROUND A BLACK MAN'S FEET. - IRON CHAINS FED INTO METAL ANKLE CUFFS. - PAUL D. ON HIS KNEES BEFORE A WHITE GUARD crotch.

direction.raw_text: YOU HUNGRY NIGGER? Paul awakens. INT. KITCHEN - DAWN. Sethe enters to find Paul asleep in the rocker by the stove. She stirs him.

direction.raw_text: Paul?..Paul?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm. What?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called you two or three times but I gave up round midnight. I thought maybe you went out somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. I'm sorry honey...

direction.raw_text: I'll make some breakfast - you get yourself washed up. Sethe begins to make breakfast as Beloved enters the kitchen and sees Paul has slept in the rocker. She looks at him with a smile, as if she knows more than she's letting on. Paul registers the look. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. Paul is asleep in the rocker...He is restless...HE DREAMS: EXT. A ROAD IN VIRGINIA - DAY. Paul is chained by the ankles to forty-five other men. He hands are shackled. In his mouth, an iron bit... The men are being led by WHITE GUARDS with rifles. Camera follows them under a burning sun as they approach; A TRENCH. One thousand feet long. Five feet deep. Five feet wide. Camera tilts down to reveal, within the trench; WOODEN BOXES, with scrap limber roofs and a door of bars fitted on them like a cage that opens up to a wall of red dirt stretching two feet above the top of the bars themselves. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. Paul awakens...his face and body drenched in sweat. EXT. FIELD BETWEEN 124 AND THE STOREROOM - NIGHT. Paul D. walks across the field with a thin blanket over his nightclothes - walking toward the storeroom. In the window of her bedroom, Sethe watches him - sensing he is moving further and further away from her. In the window of Denver's room, Beloved watches Paul as well - with a pleased expression.

direction.raw_text: : PAUL'S MEMORIES; EXT. A FIELD IN GEORGIA - DAY. A RIFLE SHOT. A WHITE GUARD SHOUTS;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiiiiiii! EXT. TRENCH - DAY. Three white Men walk along the trench unlocking the cage doors one by one... One by one, the Black men emerge and stand in a line in the trench. When all are assembled, A SECOND RIFLE SHOT signals them to climb out of the trench to the ground above. Waiting for them above the trench, is one thousand feet of chain. Each Black Man bends over and waits as the First Man on line threads the chain through his leg iron, passing it to the second and so on... As they connect each other to the chain, Camera Pans down the line of men and while not a word is spoken, WE HEAR THEIR THOUGHTS...thoughts to themselves, or, if possible, through their eyes to the man beside them:
