direction.raw_text: I'm a make it..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New man. New man...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steady now, steady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me... this mornin's bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE BLACK MEN ARE CHAINED AND KNEELING IN A STRAIGHT LINE. The White Guards walk passed them. one White Guard stops in front of the man beside Paul D. He turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breakfast? Want some breakfast nigger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hungry nigger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here you go. The White Guard unzips his fly and undoes his pants and moves a step closer to the Black Man's mouth. Paul D. looks ahead, trembling...He vomits...The Guard steps away as another Guard steps in and hits Paul on the shoulder with a rifle.. EXT. FIELD - DAY. The Black Men work...sledge hammers in hand... As they work, miraculously, THEY SING.."They sing about the women they knew, the children they had been...they sing of bosses and masters and misses...of mules and dogs and the shamelessness of life...They sing of sisters long gone. They sing love songs to Death." INT. TRENCH - NIGHT. A torrential downpour. The men in the wooden cages watch the rain filling the trench, corroding the red dirt wall around them. Bugs and human debris swirl around their legs and feet. Mud covering them through the cracks of the scrap lumber roof. Some finds rest. other's minds are long gone. Camera finds Paul...HE IS SCREAMING. But there is no sound coming from his mouth. Tears flow down his face, but when he touches them, he realizes; They are tears of mud. He looks up and the wooden planked roof is breaking under the power of the rain..He looks down and the water is up to his thighs. Suddenly, the chain linking his feet is pulled and he is knocked down..He gets up, searches through the mud for the chain and notices it's slack..He pulls as well.... One by one the men in the boxes realize the chain's end is being undone by the rain, as camera tracks down towards the last box to the dirt wall, into which the chain has been locked...It is giving way within the muddy wall. THE MEN BREAK THROUGH THE ROTTED WOOD ROOFS TO FREEDOM... WIDE ANGLE; AS THE MEN CLIMB OUT OF THE MUDDY COFFINS, GRASPING FOR A HOLD, CRAWLING WITH EVERY MUSCLE OF THEIR BODIES - TO GET OUT OF THE TRENCH before mud and water drown them.... Paul climbs with the will of ten men, with every ounce of strength he has left... END of MEMORY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. COLD ROOM - A WINTER NIGHT. Paul D. is wide awake. The memories won't let him sleep. Winter has arrived and the night is cold. He lies underneath a thin blanket in yet another sleeping place, even further from the house. He adds newspapers under and around his body to stay warm. He looks as if he has given up on sleeping altogether. He hears the door to the cold room open. But he does not turn to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want in here? Beloved enters the cold room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to touch me on the inside part and call me my name. She hoists up her skirt and turns her head away.. Paul stares at a silver lard can so as not to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When good people take you in and treat you good, you ought to try to be good back. You don't....Sethe loves you. Much as her own daughter. You know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She don't love me like I love her. I don't love nobody but her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what you come in here for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to touch me on the inside part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever since you come here - feel like I got a new devil to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to touch me. On the inside part. And you have to call me my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't no chains on me no more. I don't have to do nothing...Now, go back in that house and go to bed. Paul continues to stare at the lard can - like Lot's wife, he's fearful what turning to look will do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me my name. Beloved moves closer, right up behind him, entwining her arms around his body, like chains..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Ain't no chains on me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Ain't no chains on me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go if you say it. Tears well up in his eyes. Paul can feel her warmth. He surrenders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved. Beloved presses her body against his. He turns and grabs her, kissing her with a passion bordering on hatred. EXT. COLD HOUSE - NIGHT. Denver sits outside the cold house - and listens to the sounds of lovemaking. And cries. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. Sethe, Denver, Paul and Beloved eat dinner...in silence. INT. COLD HOUSE - ANOTHER NIGHT. Beloved is wrapping her body with a blanket as Paul lies on his bed of newspapers - their lovemaking finished. Beloved gives him a final look - no tenderness or affection or even friendliness. Just a cold look, void of respect or even attraction. She exits the cold house, leaving Paul alone. He is on the verge of tears. INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Paul stands above the sleeping Sethe - his guilt driving him mad. He wants to touch her, to wake her, to ask for forgiveness and help. But he can not and buries his head in his hands. EXT. SAWYER RESTAURANT - LATE AFTERNOON. Paul waits outside in the cold, cupping his hands and breathing inside to keep them warm. He is rehearsing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look here Sethe..You ain't gonna like what I got to say but I got to say it...See, it's not the..a man can't...what I mean is, it ain't really me..see, it ain't weakness, the kind of weakness I can fight, that girl is doing it. I know you think I never liked her nohow, still don't, but she is doing it to me anyway. Fixing me, Sethe, she's fixed me and I can't break it... Sethe appears, exiting the back door of the restaurant with a scrap pan in the crook of her arm. To her surprise. she finds Paul waiting for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, you make me feel like a young girl, you coming by to pick me up after work. Nobody ever did that before. Better watch out, I might start looking forward to it. She tosses the bones and skins from the scrap pan into a heap before four dogs who wait there as if by appointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to rinse this out. She enters the restaurant. Paul watches the dogs eat - watching them getting what they wanted. Sethe re-appears with a cloth over her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get off early or what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took off early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a way of speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not cut back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. They got plenty of work with them pigs..More they can handle. I just.. (Sethe waits) You ain't gonna like what I'm about to say, Sethe. Sethe steps forward to hear what Paul came to tell her. There is no apprehension or anger in her look. Instead, a calm resolve - as if she were already able to accept whatever he had to tell her without it being anyone's fault. As if she already knew he cane to say he was leaving her. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well say it, Paul D...whether I like it or not. Paul knows what she's expecting. And when he sees her diminished expectation, the melancholy without blame in her eyes....he can't tell her about Beloved. He is filled with respect and admiration for her in that moment. Something pops into his head and out of his mouth that wasn't planned;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you pregnant, Sethe. Would you do that for me? Sethe breaks up with laughter. Paul joins in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You came by here to ask me that!? You are one crazy-headed man. You right; I don't like it!...Don't you think I'm a little too old to start that all over again? She slips her fingers into his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about it. Paul lifts them, putting the tips of her fingers on his cheek. He smiles broadly; She laughs, shaking her head. A burden transformed into a gift, so suddenly. They begin walking. Sethe and Paul catch and snatch each other's fingers, stealing quick pats on the behind, joyfully. Paul throws his arm around Sethe and squeezes. She lets her head touch his chest. They stop and stay that way for a moment - not breathing. Sethe closes her eyes. Paul looks up to the trees lining the roadside like defending arms against attack. Softly, suddenly, it begins to snow. Sethe opens her eyes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercy. EXT. BLUESTONE ROAD - EARLY EVENING. On the road towards 124, Paul and Sethe run hand in hand. Snow falling all around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I been on my feet all day, Paul D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where I been? Sitting down!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! I don't have the legs for this! They slow to a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then give'em to me. Before she can stop him, Paul hoists Sethe up over his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need some babies..somebody to play with in the snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure would like to give it a try. Need a willing partner though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll say..Very, very willing. They continue laughing and moving down Bluestone Road when they are jolted by the appearance of; Beloved. Waiting in her usual place for Sethe. Her hands wrapped in a long shawl, waiting to be given to Sethe. Her eyes only on Sethe, not even acknowledging Paul's presence. Sethe gets herself down from Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazy girl. You out here with nothing on. She takes the shawl from Beloved's hands and wraps it around her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to learn more sense than that. She walks on ahead with Beloved. Paul, suddenly icy cold and filled with anger, walks behind. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE ROAD - NIGHT. Denver waits on the porch. Sethe and Beloved walk by her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening, girl. Sethe and Beloved enter the house. As Paul approaches, he stops before Denver. Their eyes meet. Paul stares at her, as if to ask - "Who's ally are you?"...Denver, unnerved by his look, runs into the house. Paul waits on the porch until, a moment later, Sethe re-appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know you not sleeping out there tonight, are you Paul D.? (Paul doesn't reply) You come upstairs tonight. Where you belong...and stay there. As if healed by her strength, Paul's face melts into relief. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. Denver is cleaning the dishes. Beloved sits like an angry, upset five year old with her fingers in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She likes him here... (to Denver) Make him go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'd be mad if he leaves. Beloved didn't consider that. Her fingers move violently in her mouth as if something were bothering her...until, finally, she pulls out a back tooth...her lips slightly bloody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OOoo..didn't that hurt you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like my dreams...I get two dreams, see..One, I exploding...BUUOOGGG...The other I being swallowed. Sometimes it's hard to keep my head on my neck, or these legs connected to my hips...One day I think I might wake up and I'll be in pieces.. (Looks at tooth) Maybe it's starting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh stop. It's just a tooth. Probably wisdom. Does it hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why don't you cry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it hurts, why don't you cry? Beloved, eases herself into Denver's arms, and cries... EXT. WINDOW OF 124 - NIGHT. We see Sethe and Paul united as the snow begins to pile up. INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT. Sethe lies with Paul, in the dark, her face looking up to the ceiling. Paul is asleep. On her face are reservations. She rises, crossing to the window to look out. At the same time, Beloved appears silently at the doorway of the room, looking at Sethe - hurt and sad. She walks by without Sethe noticing her. Sethe takes a breath at the window, watching the snow fall. Then, as she moves back to the bed,... Camera moves ahead of her to: A DIFFERENT BED IN WHICH HALLE IS TRYING TO FALL ASLEEP. A YOUNGER SETHE CRAWLS IN BESIDE HIM. WE ARE IN MEMORY; INT. HALLE & SETHE'S SWEET HOME LIVING QUARTERS - NIGHT. Sethe, Halle and the baby girl (Beloved) sleep together by the wall. The boys sleep together under a window.  Halle is trying to sleep but Sethe is awake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you think about Schoolteacher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He white, ain't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, is he different like Mr. Garner was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was he different?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he and Mrs. Garner - they ain't like other whites I seen before. Mr. Garner always spoke soft, for one. Mrs. Garner too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't matter. Loud or soft, what they say is the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Garner let you buy out your mother. Found that house for her to live in from those friends of his in Ohio...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. He did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he hadn't, she would have dropped in his cooking stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, he did it. Let you work off her fee, lending yourself out on Sundays. He could of said no. He didn't tell you no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he didn't tell me no. She worked here ten years. If she worked another ten, ya think she would have made it? I pay him for her last years and in return he got you, me and three more coming..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He always treated you fair. Called you all men - said he never wanted niggers on his farm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just it. We was men because he said so. We was men because we was on his land. You think he be calling us men if we ever walked off his land?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When we walk, don't matter what they call you. You'll be free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe..baby girl, that ain't gonna happen. Not by walking, anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Schoolteacher in there told me to quit lending myself out. That phrase "..while the boys is small"..causes Sethe to look at her sleeping boys..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But..then..how you gonna buy yourself out? Or them? (points to the children) Or me? Halle raises himself up to face her, to give her the final blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't gonna be no buying us out, like I did with mama. Or them. As far as Schoolteacher concerned, ain't no other life ahead for any of us but this one. Sethe understands, looks to her sleeping children and is frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halle....what we going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixo, ya know he creeps out at night..he says the way they took my ma'am..he says freedom is that way. He and Paul A. got a plan.  They heard of this man, what they call an underground agent...if we do what he says, don't need no buy out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean...? But what if we caught? What'd they do to us? To the children?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same thing they're doing now, honey - only quicker. EXT. SWEET HOME - A DAY REMEMBERED. Sethe carries a big basket of berries as young Howard and Bulgar run ahead of her. She turns in the opposite direction and walks along the side of the house to the back entrance of the kitchen. She passes the open window of the classroom and hears;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe? Hearing her name, Sethe stops and peeks through the window. Schoolteacher is standing over the student, who has been writing in a notebook. Schoolteacher licks his finger and thumbs a couple of pages before saying;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. That's not the way. I told you to put her human characteristics on the left; her animal ones on the right. And don't forget to line them up. Although Sethe doesn't entirely understand, something about the words disturb her. She looks to her children. INT. MRS. GARNER'S BEDROOM - A DAY REMEMBERED. Mrs. Garner is sick in bed with a goiter. Sethe enters with some soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I can swallow that. Too thick. I'm sure it's too thick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want me to loosen it up with a little water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Take it away. Bring me some cool water, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am... Sethe helps her drink a glass of cold water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you can have quite a few. (drinks) Mmmm. Thank you Sethe. Now tell me, I know Halle's no trouble but the others, the Pauls and Sixo - how's my brother-in- law handling them? All right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes Ma'am. Look like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do what he tells them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't need telling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. That's a mercy. I know he's no Mr. Garner. But after he died, I had no else to turn to. I would've had to sell one. It wasn't even enough selling Paul F. And in my condition. I needed help. People said I shouldn't be alone here with nothing but Negroes. And he is a learned man being a schoolteacher... As Sethe fills Mrs. Garner's basin with fresh water, she looks out the window and sees: SCHOOLTEACHER outside with his students, we notice HE WEARS A VERY DISTINCTIVE HAT as Mrs. Garners description continues;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I know his ways might be a little more strict but as long as the men do as they're told I'm sure it'll be fine. All right, I'm through.. Talking makes me tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am. INT. BARN - A NIGHT REMEMBERED. Sethe lies beaten and raped, her clothes torn, her body aching and sweaty. She struggles to get to her feet and exit the barn. INT. HALLE AND SETHE'S LIVING QUARTERS - NIGHT. Sethe opens the door to find her children asleep. She is about to wake them when; She notices Mrs. Garner's light is on in her bedroom window. Sethe, blind with rage, decides there's one thing she must do before she takes her children to the meeting place. INT. MRS. GARNER'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Mrs. Garner lies ailing through a sleepless night when her bedroom door opens. Sethe enters - her appearance tells all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God Sethe..what happened to you? EXT. SWEET HOME - NIGHT. Sethe carried her baby girl in one arm, her two boys by the hand with the other...They move as fast as they can. EXT. CORN FIELD - NIGHT. They arrive at the meeting place where A WOMAN crouching in the field is waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up. You're late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But ma'am...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go with her! Do what I tell ya! Sethe carefully hands her baby girl to the woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put sugar water on that cloth for her to suck so she won't forget me til I come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halle wasn't there. I gotta go back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You crazy..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take em out. Now! I'll get there myself. I got her milk...I'll get there...Don't worry. She kisses her baby girl, a little too hard perhaps, waking her...along with the boys...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go..Go! Now! Sethe disappears back into the corn field leaving the Woman holding the baby girl... as Bulgar cries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama? EXT. CORN FIELD CLOSER TO SWEET HOME HOUSE - NIGHT. Sethe exits the corn field and heads for her living quarters when suddenly; THE FOUR BOYS appears from out of nowhere..two restraining her, one holding a horsewhip....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You nigger bastard.. Sethe struggles and is about to scream out when she is slapped and muffled and dragged into the corn field to be beaten..... END OF MEMORY; INT. SETHE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT. Sethe awakens, sweating from having fallen asleep and reliving her past nightmare. She sits up and realizes where she is. She looks beside her and sees Paul asleep. She lays down, pressing her body against his so that there is no space between - enfolding her arms around him. EXT. PIG SLAUGHTERHOUSE - DAY. Pigs are crying in the chute as Paul, Stamp Paid and twenty other workers push and prod them towards the slaughterhouse. Although steeped in pig shit on a wintry day - his hands numb from the cold - Paul D. is in high spirits. HE SINGS as he works much to the amusement of his fellow co-workers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey - you like this work so much maybe you best get in the chute with the others. You ain't got much more sense than they do. The men laugh. Paul smiles and brushes it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't just a job reason to sing. Other things a man's got to look forward to that a job just a way to spend your day til the good times arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good times? Ain't no such day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, now...it's all a state a mind, right Paul D. If you can think it, it can happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than that. When a man can make plans then a man can make good times happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh the man's got plans! You saving up for a gold mine, boy. (more laughter)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better then gold, my friend. Me and my woman's planning on starting a family. Stamp Paid's face registers sudden concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New life. Born free, hear! Now if that don't define a good tine, I don't know what does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing born free ever again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you talkin? Nobody owns us no more. Nobody gonna own my children neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children inherit what come before'em. Just cause you can't see no chains, don't mean they not there. We're not free men. We're somewhere between freedom and chains. And as long as the world is white, that's where we're stayin. The truth of this causes the men to be silent as they continue working. Stamp Paid looks at Paul, confused by what he should do. EXT. PIG SLAUGHTERHOUSE - LATER THAT DAY. The men are on break. Paul sits alone enjoying a lunch packed by Sethe...Stamp Paid approaches and sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free country. No matter what anybody says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like the way you think, boy. Good. Good to think that way. Friend of mine, Baby Suggs was her name...sort of became a preacher in these parts..that was her way of thinking too. When she was at her best, that is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew Baby Suggs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes...You're not one of her Sweet Home men, now are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir...Me and my brothers and her son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe told me she died soft as cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...maybe on the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is that? Stamp Paid looks at him with sympathetic, sudden understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know, son, do you? See I had to figure that out first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what? Stamp Paid pulls out AN OLD NEWSPAPER CLIPPING from a bag he carries with him all the time. He hands it to Paul who looks to see: A DRAWING OF A YOUNG BLACK WOMAN beneath a HEADLINE; MURDER! RUNAWAY SLAVE KILLS CHILD....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That there's a picture of Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe? (studies it) Nah, that ain't her mouth. I can see where you might think it around the eyes but that there ain't her mouth. Besides, why would some black woman's picture be in the paper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't read son, do you? (Paul shakes head NO) You want me to read to you? Paul senses something terribly wrong...and doesn't know whether to say yes or no. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - EARLY EVENING. Sethe is sweeping the porch. Paul appears on the road. When he sees Sethe on the porch in the distance, he stops. Sethe sees him and smiles - but something about his slow approach to the house sends off an alarm within her. Paul makes his way to the porch. He stops before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already fed the girls. You eat? (he shakes NO) Want something? Paul doesn't answer. Instead, he steps up to her as he removes the clipping from his pocket and hands it to her. Sethe's heart stops beating for a moment - not having seen this image for many years. But she's survived worse than the telling so she faces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best you come inside. She rises and enters the house. Paul follows. INT. KITCHEN - EARLY EVENING. Paul sits at the table. Sethe begins her story seated before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have to tell you about Sweet Home. What it was. But maybe you don't know what it was like for me to get away from there. She looks for a response but expects none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did it. I got us all out. Without Halle too. Up til then it was the only thing I ever did on my own. Decided. And it came off right like it was supposed to.. She rises and begins to move about the room, circling Paul as she tries to find a way to explain it all;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We was here. Each and every one of my babies and me too. I birthed them and I got 'em out and it wasn't no accident. I did that! I had help, of course, lots of that, but still it was me doing it; me saying, "Go on" and "Now!". Me having to look out. Me using my own head. But it was more than that. It was a kind of ...'thinking-about-myself' I never knew nothing about before. It felt good. Good and right. I was big, Paul, and deep and wide and when I stretched out my arms all my children could get in between. I was that wide. Look like I loved them more after I got them here. Or maybe I couldn't love'em proper in Sweet Home 'cause they wasn't mine to love. But when I got here, when I jumped off that wagon - there wasn't nobody in the world I couldn't love if I wanted to....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MEMORY... as SETHE NARRATES:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had 28 days...28 good days of free life..... INT. SETHE'S ROOM AT 124 - A DAWN REMEMBERED. Sethe, out of habit, is awake before the sun has risen. She is fully dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...of getting up like I always did, getting dressed before the sun came out, and then realizing I had to decide myself what to do with the day... She sits on the bed, watching the sun rise. INT. THE CHILDREN'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS. Sethe watches her children sleeping, safely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Days of watching my children sleep away the morning...And taking care of my baby like it was the most important thing I had to do... Denver is asleep in a bassinet. Sethe reaches in and picks her up. She sits by a window and breast feeds her as she hums A MELODY. (This is the same melody we heard Sethe humming in the beginning of the film). Sethe's melody carries itself over the following images; EXT. 124 BLUESTONE ; WATER PUMP - DAY. Sethe is carrying a bucket of water to the house. She sees: Bulgar and Howard running and playing. Howard tackles his brother and starts tickling him. The two boys laugh hard. Sethe watches, a moment of fear across her face;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd hear my boys laughing a laugh I ain't never heard. And for a second I'd get scared - scared someone might hear them and get mad... Sethe realizes, placing down the bucket:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I remembered...and if they laughed that hard til it hurt, that would be the only hurt they had all day.... Sethe sobs, uncontrollably. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Ella teaches Sethe a new stitch as she chatters on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had us days of company... EXT. FIELD - DAY. Another woman teaches Sethe the alphabet, as Sethe cradles Denver and the Little Girl (Beloved) crawls around her feet. INT. KITCHEN - DAY. Baby Suggs and Sethe cook with a kitchen full of men and women who have come for a visit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...of ease and real talk. Talks about the Fugitive Bill, Dred Scott or book learning...Talks as quiet or as stormy as we wanted... Two men get into an argument to the amusement of the women. EXT. CLEARING IN THE WOODS - DAY. As folks gather to hear Baby Suggs preach, she introduces a smiling, shy Sethe to each one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And when everyone would gather to hear Baby Suggs, I saw something I ain't never seen before in my whole life... Alone for a moment, Sethe looks around at the crowd of faces; Sethe's Melody stops as Baby Suggs stands on her rock and calls to the crowd:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let the children come! FROM OUT OF THE WOODS, CHILDREN RUN INTO THE CLEARING. Camera follows the joyous exodus to reveal: THE CLEARING IS FILLED WITH ADULTS the entire black community of the days when Sethe first arrived. The children run to their respective families;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let your mother's hear you laugh!! The children, loving the game, laugh hard. The adults get a kick out of it. Sethe watches her boys and hides her laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let the grown men come!! OUT OF THE WOODS, A GROUP OF GROWN MEN COME INTO THE CLEARING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The men form a circle and dance as the crowd supports them with a clapping rhythm. A SONG arises from the women to accompany to dance....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now...you women...I want you to cry. For the living. For the dead....Just cry. Camera follows those women who are not singing as one by one, they remember and weep... Sethe watches...and weeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ....Something in me knew Halle was never gonna knock on our door. He was never gonna see what I saw that day. I saw what men look like...and I saw mothers, for the first time. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Stamp Paid walks up to the porch carrying a TWO BIG BASKETS OF BLACKBERRIES ... his body dirty, scratched and bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it was Stamp Paid who started it. He walked six miles to the riverbank, slid into a ravine, reached through blood drawing thorns, suffered mosquitoes, wasps and the meanest lady spiders in the State just to bring us those berries. He places the baskets on the porch in front of Baby Suggs, Sethe who is holding Denver..and the Little Girl (Beloved).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a sight you are, Stamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worth it though. Just one bite of these berries and you feel down right anointed. He puts one into Denver's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's too little for that, Stamp. Her bowels be soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll sickify her stomach..Now go wash up round back...crazy fool.. Stamp exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was real nice of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good one, no doubt of that. I can get three, maybe four pies out of this. Seems a shame just for us though. I'm gonna invite Ella and John over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout if I make a couple of chickens to back it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's how it began... INT. KITCHEN - DAY. Sethe and Baby Suggs and Ella and several other women cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Three pies became twelve...two hens became five turkeys... EXT.THE FIELD/124 BLUESTONE RD. - EVENING. Various images of people gathered enjoying food and drink...laughing and singing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and Ella and John turned into almost ninety others... - Women serving up the food... - Older men sitting and talking as they eat... - Younger men playing with the children. Chasing them with sheets on their backs, scaring them into laughter.. - A Man with a guitar playing a blues song and singing. While Sethe enjoys her free life and, most of all, her children - the boys running around her..Denver in her arms..Her Little Girl (Beloved) by her side.. Baby Sugg's visits with various guests, serving up the food...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Everybody ate so well and laughed so much... INTERCUT; Images of whispers exchanged between some of the women:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...it made them angry... Women head to head with a remark or an eye of disapproval towards Baby Suggs as she continues cooking and feeding....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pies, the turkeys...the bread pudding and shortbread..the one whole block of ice brought all the way from Cincinnati - it made 'em mad...Loaves and fishes were Jesus's powers...they did not belong to an ex-slave who never had a white boy beat her, who had her freedom bought, who rented a house from white folks that hated slavery worse than they hated slaves...It made'em furious - her thoughtless generosity and un-called for pride...She had over stepped...offended them by giving too much...and they left their disapproval there so's you could smell in the air the whole next day... EXT. THE FIELD/ 124 BLUESTONE RD. - THE FOLLOWING DAY. Baby Suggs works the field, not far from Stamp Paid...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later on I wondered why no one warned us...why no one saw them coming and ran to 124 to tell us... She chops at the soil over the roots of the pepper plants. She stops - sensing something is wrong. She looks up at a clear blue sky...She hears the birds and the stream way down beyond the woods.. She looks around and sees Bulgar, Howard and the Little Girl (Beloved) playing with loud voices by the side of the house. She sees Sethe squatted in the pole beans with Denver in a bushel basket beside her. The clok, clok of wood being chopped causes her to look over to Stamp Paid, helping out with the axe... She returns to her work...but something is deeply wrong. And then she hears it; THE SOUND OF HORSES and A HORSE DRAWN WAGON coming from the distance. (The same sound Sethe heard in her first memory of the sycamores earlier on) She rises up and looks; POV; EXT. BLUESTONE ROAD - DAY. Far in the distance, FOUR HORSEMEN ARE RIDING TOWARD THEM. ONE DRIVES A WAGON and IS WEARING A DISTINCTIVE HAT - IT IS SCHOOLTEACHER.....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. THE FIELD OF 124 BLUESTONE - DAY. Sethe continues working until she notices peripherally that Baby Suggs is standing stock still, staring at something. Sethe rises and looks in the same direction; CUT BACK TO: EXT. BLUESTONE ROAD - DAY. The Four Horsemen are closer... CUT BACK TO: EXT. THE FIELD OF 125 BLUESTONE - DAY. Sethe's face freezes in terror as ... Stamp Paid, in between chops, looks up and sees the two women..then turns his face to see the men. BUT IT IS SETHE'S FACE WE CONCENTRATE ON - AS WE INTERCUT THE ONCOMING APPROACH OF THE FOUR HORSEMEN and HEAR HER WORDS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...There's a Look whitefolks get..a Look every Negro learns to recognize along with his ma'am's tit..That righteous Look that's like a flag going up the pole..the righteousness that announces the whip, the fist, the burning, the lie...long before it happens in the open... Over the above speech, we see in Sethe's expression a death of soul - an instantaneous loss of hope for possibilities of joy and life. And with it, an insane rage. Sethe grabs Denver out of the basket, then scrambles after the crawling Little Girl (Beloved), scooping her under her free arm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howard!...Bulgar! The tone of her voice cause the boys to freeze. She runs towards them, grabbing one by the hand and ordering the other to run in front of them. She moves and speaks with efficient clarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shed!...Get in the shed!...Run! Baby Suggs and Stamp Paid watch helplessly - EXT. 124 BLUESTONE - The Four Horsemen - Schoolteacher, his Nephew, a Slave Catcher and a Sheriff - arrive at the house and dismount, tying their horses to the front gate (which is no longer there). The Nephew scampers to the front of the house and peers in the window - he listens. Hearing nothing he motions for them to go round the side of the house. Camera follows them as it reveals Baby Suggs and Stamp Paid standing exactly where we left them...Except; They are both staring at the shed - out of which strange noises, thuds and the FRIGHTENED CRIES OF CHILDREN are heard.... Two Black Boys and several Woman are coming up the road. The Slave Catcher motions with his rifle for them to stop - and they do. The men move towards the shed, meeting up with the Nephew as he runs past Baby Suggs and Stamp Paid... POV; Camera moves closer towards the shed, the sounds coning from within more audible now... INT. THE SHED - The Nephew opens the door. The Four Men enter.... Howard and Bulgar are bleeding in the sawdust, unconscious - a bloody shovel lays near them. Sethe is holding a blood-soaked Little Girl (Beloved) to her chest with one hand...and Denver by the heels of the other. She is swinging Denver toward the wall planks, misses then tries again... When out of nowhere, Stamp Paid rushes by the horrified white men and GRABS DENVER OUT OF SETHE'S HAND before she can swing her a second time... Stillness. Schoolteacher looks at the carnage...a bloody saw lies at Sethe's feet, the weapon she used on her own child's throat. The Nephew is paralyzed...horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What she go and do that for?...What she go and do that for? Baby Suggs walks in. Whatever amount of God's grace she could imagine and will into being, vanishes with one look into that shed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all better go on. (to Schoolteacher) Nothing here to claim, I guess. Look like your business is over. Mine's started. Schoolteacher beats his hat against his thigh and spits in the shed before exiting, followed by the catcher and the nephew. The Sheriff speaks to Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have to take you in. No trouble now. You've done enough to last you.... Sethe doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come quiet, here, and I won't have to tie you up. Meanwhile, Baby Suggs notices who breathes and who does not and moves straight to the boys.... Stamp Paid extends his arm to Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe. You take my arm and gimme yours. Sethe turns to him, the first time she's looked into anyone's eyes and sees Denver in his arms...A sound escapes from her throat as though she'd made a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going out here and send for a wagon. He exits. Baby Suggs rubs the boys' hands, tries to raise their eyelids, spits on her dress and wipes away the blood as they slowly regain a dazed consciousness..She whispers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg you pardon..I beg your pardon.. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - Sethe, clutching the dead baby to her chest, is led out of the shed by Stamp Paid, Outside, a throng of black faces have gathered who stop murmuring the second they see her. Among them are Ella and Lady Jones. They are shocked and pained. Sethe is led past them to a waiting cart - in total silence. Baby Suggs, at the same time, is getting the boys up the porch into the house. When Denver cries in Stamp Paid's arms, she stops..lets the boys sit and runs towards the cart. Sethe is seated in the cart beside the Sheriff. Baby Suggs takes the crying Denver from Stamp Paid..She tells the Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me..but the child needs nursin..needs the mother's milk..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she's best come too. Baby Suggs approaches Sethe who sees Denver crying and reaches for her without letting the baby go. Baby Suggs resists;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One at a time!...And you gotta clean yourself up! But Sethe only wants her living child. The two women struggle as Stamp Paid does what he can..Finally, Sethe wins and takes Denver with her free hand, undoes her dress and nurse's her with a bloody breast.. Baby Suggs breaks inside. Breaks right in two, although from outwards appearances, she looks merely numbed by shock. A WHITE BOY makes his way through the crowd with a pair of shoes and hands them to her..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama says Wednesday. She says you got to have them fixed by Wednesday. Baby Suggs looks at him not understanding..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear, Baby? She says Wednesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon..Lord, I beg your pardon..I sure do....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : PRESENT DAY (END OF MEMORY) : INT. 124 BLUESTONE ROAD - NIGHT. Paul D. sits at the kitchen table. The story told. Sethe looks out the window...and waits..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your love is too thick, Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love is or it isn't. Thin love ain't love at all...I did stop him. I took and put my babies where they'd be safe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't work though, did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It worked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Your boys gone, you don't know where. One girl dead, the other can't go farther than the yard. How did it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ain't at Sweet Home! Schoolteacher ain't got'em!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe there's worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It ain't my job to know what's worse. It's my job to know what is and keep them away from what I know is terrible. I did that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you did was wrong, Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should have gone back there? Taken my babies back there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There could have been a way. Some other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got two feet, Sethe. Not four! That jumped out before he had a chance to choose saying it. Sethe has no response...The distance between these two people in this small room is suddenly vast. Paul rises, playing with his hat...not knowing how to leave. But desperately needing to. He moves to the exit and stops..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can set aside supper for me... Might be late getting back... Unable to look at her, he turns to exit. When Sethe speaks in a soft, forgiving tone, he stops to listen;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After all I told you, Paul D. and after telling me how many feet I have, you think saying goodbye is gonna break me into pieces? Paul turns to look at her and realizes she saw right through him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a sweet man. Unable to bear it, Paul turns and leaves... Sethe stands still, fighting tears, and whispers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long, Paul D. INT. KITCHEN - DAY. Sethe is scrubbing the floor, with Denver trailing by with dry rags. Beloved enters holding a pair of ice skates;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do these do? Sethe and Beloved look up. Sethe smiles;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Lord...where'd you dig up those?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There for skating on the ice. We have another pair and half of another, I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we try them? Sethe takes the skates and looks at them with a curious lightness:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ice skating? Ha... (beat) Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure mama?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strikes me that after your man leaves, it might just be the wrong time to be scrubbing floors... might just be the perfect time to go ice skating. Denver and Beloved register hopefulness in the light of Sethe's attitude. Sethe speaks to Denver;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go get the shawls..and find me an old shoe for that half a pair... The girls get excited. Sethe tosses the scrub brush into the pail. EXT. A FROZEN CREEK - DAY. A bright, cold winter day. Beloved wears a pair of old skates. Denver wears the second pair and Sethe has one skate and one shoe..The two girls giggle and fall as they try to skate on the ice... helping each other up. Their skirts whirling...their laughter mingled with screams of delight. Sethe, wearing only shoes, watches them and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, ma'am...try! Sethe steps onto the ice and takes a few strides and promptly falls on her rear. The girls scream with laughter. Sethe tries to get up and falls, their laughter infecting her as well. The girls try to help her and fall over each other in the trying. Denver rises and tries an independent glide. The tip of her skate hits a bump and she falls, flapping her arms wildly. All three laugh so hard, they start coughing. Beloved goes to Denver's aid. Sethe rises up on her hands and knees, her laughter shaking her chest and causing her eyes to tear in the cold air. Beloved helps Denver, and falls as well. The two girls see Sethe laughing and play it up even more, a few more times... Until, Denver notices something and motions Beloved to stop and look. The two glide back to Sethe. Her laughter has stopped, but her tears have not... They gently, comfortingly, touch her shoulder. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT. It is a snowy night outside the windows. Sethe has laid out blankets and quilts in front of the fire in the stove. She has made sweet milk that she hands to the girls before taking her place in between them, on the floor, facing the fire; Denver, on her right, rests her head on her lap. Beloved sits on her left. She looks over to Beloved who is staring at the fire. The illumination highlights her beauty and her profile; the chin, mouth, forehead - all copied and exaggerated in a huge shadow the fire threw on the wall. Sethe can't help but stare as another thought occurs to her;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...All I remember is how she loved the bottom of burned bread. Her little hands...I wouldn't know 'em if they slapped me".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..."Here. Look here. See this mark? If you can't tell me by my face, look here." Beloved lifts her head towards the fire at the same time she leans back to rest on a propped-up pillow. In the flickering of the firelight, Sethe can see: A SMILE OF A SCAR BENEATH HER CHIN. Sethe knows before she's aware of it consciously. And just as it hits her, BELOVED BEGINS TO HUM A MELODY. Sethe recognizes it as her own melody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made that song up. I made it up and sang it to my children... Denver lifts her head from her mother's lap to look at Sethe, knowing what is happening....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Nobody knows that song but me and my children. Beloved turns to Sethe;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it. A click. Sethe looks at her daughter, returned. "There is no gasp of astonishment - no exclaim for the miraculous. For what is truly miraculous is so, because the magic lies in the fact that you knew it was there for you all along."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MORNING; INT. KITCHEN - MORNING. It's snowy white outside. The girls are still asleep in front of the stove. But Denver awakens upon hearing her mother load the stove with dry wood and begin to cook breakfast. Sethe hears her wake up and turns, as she beats eggs in a bowl;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back stiff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OOh, yeah...Don't know if it's the floor or the skating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could be that fall you took.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was fun. Beloved snores lightly beside her;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I wake her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, let her rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She likes to see you off in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make sure she does. But first I'm going  make up a nice, big breakfast against that cold outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't you be late for work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't matter. First time I'll be late in nine years. No great trouble..Whatever goes on out there goes on with or without me showing up on time... don't matter... (looks at the girls) The world is in this room, baby. This is all there is and all there needs to be. Denver smiles - but it is a cautious smile. Something about her mother's statement both elates and disturbs her. EXT. BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. A conflicted and contrite Stamp Paid walks through the snow down Bluestone road towards 124. As he does, he remembers his last conversation with Baby Suggs; MEMORY: EXT. RICHMOND STREET - DAY. A fall day. Leaves ankle high. Stamp Paid is walking when he sees baby Suggs carrying a carpetbag full of repaired shoes. He crosses over to her as he gets her attention;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You missed the Clearing meeting three Saturdays running. Baby Suggs turns to her old friend - but there is no sign of welcome or recognition. There is a noticeable change in her demeanor. She continues walking. He follows;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Folks came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Folks come. Folks go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me carry that. He reaches for the carpetbag but Baby Suggs pulls it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a delivery around here. Name of Tucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yonder. Twin chestnuts in the yard. They walk a bit, until;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This Saturday - you coming to Call or what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I call them, and they come what on earth am I going to say to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say the Word! Two whitemen raking leaves look up at the sound of Stamp Paid's voice, which was too loud. So he whispers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Word. What you was put here to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the last thing they took from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you got to do it. You got to. Can't nobody Call like you. You have to be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I have to do is get in my bed and lay down. I want to fix on something harmless in this world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What world are you talking about? Ain't nothing harmless down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blue. That doesn't hurt nobody. Yellow neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You getting into bed to think about yellow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I likes yellow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what? When you get through with blue and yellow, then what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't say. It's something can't be planned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You blaming God. That what you're doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Stamp. I ain't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saying whitefolks won. That what you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those white things have taken all I had or dreamed. I'm saying ain't no bad luck in this world 'cept for white folks..They just don't know when to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saying nothing counts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying they came into my yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saying God give up? Nothing left for us but pour out our own blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying they came into my yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You punishing Him, ain't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not like He punished me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do that, Baby. It ain't right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was a time I knew what was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I know is what I see: a nigger woman hauling shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, Baby. He stops her, before the Twin Chestnuts of the Tucker house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to be steady. "These things too will pass". What you looking for? A miracle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm looking for what I was put here to look for: the back door. They exchange a look of silence and finality. She turns and walks to the back door of the house and knocks. A moment later a White Woman appears, takes the carpetbag and keeps Baby waiting on the back steps while she goes in for a dime. Baby rests on the railing until the whitewoman returns. MEMORY END. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Now, Stamp Paid feels the need to find out what's going on inside 124 since he caused Paul to leave. He approaches the porch, then the front door. He raises his hands to knock - but he can't bring himself to do it. He turns to walk away then stops. He turns back and with a force of will, KNOCKS LOUDLY upon the door. No answer. He KNOCKS AGAIN. Still no answer. He steps back, trying to sense if anyone's there. He turns to leave when he sees; TWO HEADS in the window. Denver and Beloved. Denver bolts away, but Beloved remains a moment longer - looking in Stamp Paid's eye, then disappearing into the house. Stamp Paid is unnerved by her look. INT. SAWYER'S RESTAURANT - LATE MORNING. Sethe enters late, putting on her apron as SAWYER yells;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell you thinking, girl? Strolling in here this late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk to me, Mr. Sawyer. Don't say nothing to me this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What? You talking back to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you don't say nothing to me. Sethe begins organizing her counter to make pies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better get them pies made! Sethe ignores him as she begins. Sawyer is at a loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too sweet! You make it too sweet they don't eat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it the way I always do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Too sweet. (he exits) INT. ELLA'S HOUSE - DAY. Ella opens the front door for Stamp Paid. He looks disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you been keeping yourself? I told John must be cold if Stamp stay inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I been out. Stamp takes off his hat and follows Ella, who is doing laundry in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was over to Baby Suggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want there? Somebody invite you in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Baby's kin. I don't need no invite to look after her people. Ella shrugs and continues folding wet laundry on a line behind the stove. Stamp sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody new there. A woman. Thought you might know who she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't no new Negroes in this town I don't know about. What she look like? You sure that wasn't Denver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might see anything at all at 124.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: True.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better ask Paul D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't locate him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's sleeping in the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The church!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Asked Rev. Pike if he could stay in the cellar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cold as charity in there! What he do that for? Any number'll take him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't nobody read minds long distance. All he have to do is ask somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Why he have to ask? Can't nobody offer? What's going on? Since when a black man come to town have to sleep in the cellar like a dog?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unrile yourself, Stamp. It's only a few days he been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Shouldn't be no days! You know all about it and don't give him a hand? That don't sound like you, Ella. Me and you been pulling colored folk out the water more'n twenty years! Now you tell me you can't offer a man a bed?! A working man who can pay his own way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ask, I give him anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that necessary all of a sudden?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know him that well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know he's colored? What else there to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stamp, don't tear me up this morning! I don't feel like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's her, ain't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe. He took up with her and stayed in there and you don't want nothing to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on! Don't jump if you can't see bottom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Girl, give it up! We been friends too long to act like this. Beat. Ella knows he's right. She surrenders the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who can tell what went on in there? I never even knew who Sethe was or none of her people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know she married Baby Suggs' boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't sure I know that. Baby never laid eyes on her till she showed up here. And how'd she make it and her husband didn't? And where is he? And how she have that baby in the woods by herself? Said a whitewoman help her. Shoot. You believe that? Well, I know what kind of white that was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, no, Ella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything white floating around in the woods - if it don't got a shotgun, it's something the Lord tells me I don't want no part of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You was friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Till she showed herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't got no friends take a handsaw to their own children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's any of that got to do with Paul D.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What run him off? Tell me that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I run him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him...Showed him the newspaper. About Sethe. Read it to him. He left that very day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't tell me that. I thought he already knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't know nothing. And nobody. Except her, from when they was at that place Baby Suggs was at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knew Baby Suggs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure he knew her. Her boy Halle, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he left when he found out what Sethe did? (Stamp sits) What you say casts a different light on it, I guess...I thought- Stamp knows what she thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't come here talking 'bout Paul. You came asking about a new girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Paul D. must know who she is. Or what she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind loaded with spirits. Everywhere you look you see one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know as well as I do, Stamp, that people who die bad don't stay in the ground. Stamp can not deny this. EXT. BLUESTONE ROAD - EARLY EVENING. Sethe is walking home to her daughters. There is a serene, introverted expression on her face...as if she were detached from the world around her, safe inside. We hear her thoughts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beloved, she my daughter...She mine. She come back to me of her own free will and I don't have to explain a thing.. She had to be safe and I put her where I knew she would be. But my love was tough and she back now. She come back to me in the flesh...I won't never let her go. I'll explain to her, even though I don't have to. Why I did it. How if I hadn't killed her she would have died and that is something I couldn't let happen to her. When I explain she'll understand, cause she understands everything already..And she ain't even mad...When I put that headstone up I wanted to lay in there with you, put your head on my shoulder and keep you warm and I would have if Bulgar and Howard and Denver didn't need me, because my mind was homeless then. I couldn't lay down with you then. No matter how much I wanted to. I couldn't lay down nowhere in peace, back then. Now I can. I can sleep like the drowned, have mercy. She come back to me, my daughter, DENVER'S VOICE OVER FADES IN OVER SETHE'S....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DENVER my Beloved and she        Beloved is my is mine....               sister...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..and she is mine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; INT. 124 BLUESTONE ROAD - EARLY EVENING. Denver is cleaning the kitchen, waiting for her mother. We hear her thoughts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..I swallowed her blood right along with my mother's milk. She played with me and always came to be with me whenever I needed her. Me and her waited for our daddy. I love her. I do. She never hurt me. I love my mother but I know she killed one of her own, and tender as she is with me, I'm scared of her because of it. All the time, I'm afraid the thing that happened that made it all right to kill her own, could happen again. Whatever it is, it comes from outside this house, outside the yard. So I never leave this house and I watch over the yard so it can't happen again ... I have to keep it away from my sister...I'll protect Beloved...'Cause She's mine... BELOVED'S VO FADES IN OVER DENVER'S...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A MUDDY POOL FORMING AROUND A BLACK MAN'S FEET
IRON CHAINS FED INTO METAL ANKLE CUFFS
ON HIS KNEES BEFORE A WHITE GUARD
THE MEN BREAK THROUGH THE ROTTED WOOD ROOFS TO FREEDOM
AS THE MEN CLIMB OUT OF THE MUDDY COFFINS, GRASPING FOR A HOLD, CRAWLING WITH EVERY MUSCLE OF THEIR BODIES
TO GET OUT OF THE TRENCH
A DIFFERENT BED IN WHICH HALLE IS TRYING TO FALL ASLEEP
A YOUNGER SETHE CRAWLS IN BESIDE HIM
HE WEARS A VERY DISTINCTIVE HAT
A DRAWING OF A YOUNG BLACK WOMAN
FROM OUT OF THE WOODS, CHILDREN RUN INTO THE CLEARING
THE CLEARING IS FILLED WITH ADULTS
OUT OF THE WOODS, A GROUP OF GROWN MEN COME INTO THE CLEARING
BABY SUGGS LET YOUR WIVES AND YOUR CHILDREN SEE YOU DANCE
FOUR HORSEMEN ARE RIDING TOWARD THEM
GRABS DENVER OUT OF SETHE'S HAND
A SMILE OF A SCAR BENEATH HER CHIN
BELOVED BEGINS TO HUM A MELODY
DENVER'S VOICE OVER FADES IN OVER SETHE'S
BELOVED'S VO FADES IN OVER DENVER'S

direction.raw_text: BELOVED (VO) Beloved..She's mine       I am Beloved
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and she is mine... EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - EARLY EVENING. Beloved, waiting for Sethe to come home, sees her approaching. We hear her thoughts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not separate from her. There is no place where I stop. Her face is my own and I want to be there in the place where her face is and to be looking at it too...a hot thing..In the beginning I could see her. I could not help her because the clouds were in the way. But I could see her. The shining in her ears. I look hard at her so she will know that the clouds are in the way..I cannot lose her again. I see her face which is mine. It is the face that was going to smile at me in the place where we crouched before I come up out of the blue water. Sethe's is the face that left me. Sethe's sees me in her and I see the smile. She is my face smiling at me. It is the face I lost. Now we can join..a hot thing. Sethe comes to the waiting Beloved and smiles. She offers her hand and Beloved rises. Denver exits to them and smiles. She extends her hand to Beloved's free hand. The three women stand astride each other, arms around each other's waist as they walk toward the porch... The dusk sunlight creates THREE SHADOWS - three figures holding each other the way Sethe saw the shadows at the carnival...Only they weren't Hers, Denver's and Paul's...They were Hers, Denver's and Beloved's.... INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - EARLY EVENING. The girls rush into the house, and down the hall. Sethe enters. Then turns back to the door. C.U. ; OF SETHE'S HAND LOCKING THE FRONT DOOR AS WE HEAR;
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OF SETHE'S HAND LOCKING THE FRONT DOOR AS WE HEAR
AM BELOVED AND SHE IS MINE
LOWERING SHADES, LOCKING WINDOWS, BARRING DOORS

direction.raw_text: I AM BELOVED AND SHE IS MINE..     DENVER (VO) SHE IS MINE... OVER THE FOLLOWING CHORUS OF DIALOGUE, A MONTAGE OF IMAGES DEPICTING SETHE, BELOVED AND DENVER CLOSING UP THE HOUSE FROM THE OUTSIDE WORLD - LOWERING SHADES, LOCKING WINDOWS, BARRING DOORS.....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TELL ME THE TRUTH..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CANNOT LOSE HER AGAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DID YOU COME FROM THE OTHER SIDE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YES. I WAS ON THE OTHER SIDE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YOU CAME BACK BECAUSE OF ME?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YOU NEVER FORGOT ME?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YOUR FACE IS MINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DON'T LOVE HER TOO MUCH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DO YOU FORGIVE ME?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YOU HURT ME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I WILL PROTECT YOU.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WILL YOU STAY?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WHY DID YOU LEAVE ME WHO AM YOU?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I WILL NEVER LEAVE YOU AGAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WATCH OUT FOR HER; SHE CAN GIVE YOU DREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WHERE ARE THE MEN WITHOUT SKIN?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE WHITEFOLK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUT THERE. WAY OFF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DADDY IS COMING FOR US.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAN THEY GET IN HERE?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NO. THEY TRIED ONCE BUT I STOPPED THEM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...YOU MY BEST THING. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - EARLY EVENING. CAMERA PULLS BACK FROM THE FRONT DOOR, NOW LOCKED AGAINST THE WORLD, IN A SLOW MOVE....AS WE HEAR A BLEND OF THE THREE WOMEN'S VOICES - THE OVERLAPPING, HAUNTED THOUGHTS OF THE LIVING...

direction.raw_text: BELOVED..YOU ARE MY SISTER..YOU ARE MY DAUGHTER. YOU ARE MY FACE..YOU ARE ME..I
