direction.raw_text: ..I WAITED FOR YOU..YOU ARE MY BELOVED. DON'T LOVE HER TOO MUCH...YOU MY BEST THING.. YOU ARE MINE..YOU ARE MINE..YOU ARE MINE... BY THE TIME THE CAMERA REACHES BLUESTONE ROAD, THE VOICES ARE MIXED, UNDECIPHERABLE YET AUDIBLE... ...AUDIBLE TO STAMP PAID, WHO STANDS ON BLUESTONE RD. LISTENING TO THE HAUNTED VOICES OF 124.  HE IS FRIGHTENED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FADE- IN: EXT. CHURCH - DAY. A cold day. Paul D. sits against the church drinking from a bottle when a voice causes him to look up;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howdy. Stamp has his hands in his pockets, moving about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got any more newspaper in that pocket for me, just a waste of time. Ain't interested. Stamp sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is hard for me. But I got to do it. Two things I got to say to you. I'm a take the easy one first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's hard for you, might kill me dead. (he drinks)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come looking for you to ask your pardon. Apologize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You pick any house, any house where colored live. Pick any one and you welcome to stay there. I'm apologizing 'cause they didn't offer to tell you. But you welcome anywhere you want to be. My house. John and Ella. Miss Lady Jones..anybody. You choose. You ain't got to sleep in no cellar and I apologize for each and every night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I...I did get offered one place but I just wanted to be off by myself a spell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. Oh that's load off. I thought everybody gone crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You planning to do anything about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. I got big plans. He drinks from the bottle like an angry, broken man. It stabs at Stamp's heart to see him like this. A WHITE MAN in a horse and wagon drives up the path leading to the church. He leans stops before them and leans forward;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for a gal name of Judy. Works over by the slaughterhouse. Said she lived on Plank Road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plank Road. Yes sir. That's up a ways. Mile, maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know her? Judy? Works in the slaughterhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir, I don't, but I know Plank Road. 'Bout a mile up thataway. Paul drinks from the bottle. The White Man addresses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look here..There's a cross up there, so I guess this here's a church or used to be. Seems to me like you ought to show it some respect, you follow me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir..You right about that. That's just what I come over to talk to him about. Just that.. Paul offers no response. The White Man clicks his tongue and drives off. Stamp breathes a sigh of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember your price, Stamp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never found out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. Down to the cent.$900. Always wondered though what Mrs. Garner got for my brother Paul F. Must of been more than nine hundred dollars cause she use that money for Sweet Home for almost two years. But then they hung my other brother Paul A. up on a tree so I guess he wasn't worth the same..I wonder what was Baby Suggs worth? And Halle? I wasn't surprised when I found out they tracked down Sethe all the way to Cincinatti. Her price must have been higher than all of us - her being property that reproduced itself without cost. A breeder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No use thinking these things now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh but we got to. How we gonna know our price in the future? How are children's children's children gonna know what they cost? Who's gonna tell them? What are they gonna pay for us, if we free?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children ain't gonna need to know that kind of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll know. They'll know as soon as they born. Cause it's inside us,Stamp. It'll be inside them. We'll pass it down. Schoolteacher didn't just change the outside, he changed the mind..and the blood..and what it carries...and what it's worth..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe that. I won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a rooster named Mister down at Sweet Home. Last time I saw Halle, with that butter all over his face and me with an iron bit in my mouth, I saw Mister - sitting on a tub. He loved that tub. Like king on a throne. He was a hateful thing. Bloody and evil..But he was better than me.  Mister was allowed to be and stay what he was. Even if you cooked him you'd be cooking a rooster named Mister. But wasn't no way I'd ever be Paul D. again..Schoolteacher changed me. Was never no beating under Mr. Garner. Schoolteacher changed that. Why wouldn't a man run from that? Why wouldn't a man not work, kill, starve, pull out his own heart to stop feeling 'stead of feeling that? And it strikes me, it's got to be cause we were something else. And that something was less than a chicken sitting in the sun on a tub. He drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I had two things to say to you. I only told you one. I have to tell you the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was there Paul D...There in the yard. When she did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What yard? When who- And then Paul realizes he's talking of Sethe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It ain't what you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know what I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She ain't crazy. She love those children. She was trying to outhurt the hurter's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave off..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was only-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stamp, leave off I said! I knew her when she was a girl. She scares me and I knew her when she was a girl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't scared of Sethe. I don't believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She scares me. I scare me. And that girl in her house scares me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is she? Where she come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. Just shot up one day from a stump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She what run you off? Not what I told you 'bout Sethe? Paul thinks a moment. Then, tears brimming in his eyes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me something, Stamp. Tell me this one thing. How much is a nigger supposed to take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All he can. All he can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Why? Why? Why? Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; FADE IN; SPRING. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - MORNING. The sun shines on a warm April day..a day abundant with growth and renewed hope. But a shadow appears to be hovering over 124. It looks more worn than before...neglected, abused. A broken window...the front door off it's hinge...a front step splintered and dangerous. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - MORNING. Camera opens on the front hall and moves through the house, revealing the same neglect inside; Broken furniture, dusty floors, mess and disorder... Camera enters; INT. KITCHEN - MORNING. Dirty pans, crusted food on the table, window curtains hanging askew... Sethe sits hunched over, asleep, in a chair against the wall. She wears a dirty, torn dress that hangs on her body - which seems withered, frailer since we last saw her...In her lap lies a clean pretty dress she was in the process of sewing when she fell asleep from fatigue. A LOUD CRASH wakes her up. Followed by a LOUD FRUSTRATED YELL. Her face registers fear. She realizes where she is, what time it is...and begins organizing breakfast... She places the dress neatly on the chair, then grabs a cloth and wipes away the crumbs and dirty plates from supper, placing them in the sink... She opens a pantry cupboard to reveal BARE SHELVES except for a SINGLE EGG and a bowl of HOMINY GRAINS about 1/4 full. She searches in a panic for more food - anywhere - opening cabinets, doors - places that never stored food. She realizes there is none left. INT. DENVER'S ROOM - MORNING. Denver finished dressing. She has been able to maintain a semblance of order about her person and room.. But as she steps out into the second floor hallway, we see the same disarray as downstairs... She passes by Baby Sugg's old room and discovers; BELOVED, sprawled across the bed, half naked. Her belly is huge, her body unwashed. She looks, and behaves, like a wild animal... A broken lamp lies on the fall - pushed over by her leg as she shifted in bed. Her feet, overhanging the bed, are still touching the bedside table where the lamp sat. She is awake now - making a small hole larger in Baby Sugg's old quilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't be in here? Beloved jolts her head up to Denver. She doesn't like being looked at unawares...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about it? I sleep where I want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You best leave that quilt alone. That was grandma's quilt. Beloved looks at Denver, then at the quilt - then abruptly tears the hole apart with one strong pull. Triumphant, she gets out of bed and exits, passing Denver;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breakfast ready? I'm hungry! INT. KITCHEN - MORNING. Sethe has prepared all the food that was left and placed it on one plate which she sets on the table. She stands at the stove, with her back to us, picking crusted pieces of food off the bottom of the pan. Beloved moves straight to the chair in front of the place and begins to eat, shovelling the food into her mouth. Denver sees her mother covertly eating the burnt pan crumbs, as she pretends to wash the dishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, ma'am. Sethe turns, not realizing Denver was there as well. Their eyes meet. Sethe wonders if her daughter saw her eating the pan crumbs. She smiles;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hungry? Knowing there must be nothing left, Denver answers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am. Sethe looks relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll finish those. Why don't you sit down? Denver crosses to the dishes, taking the pan from her mother. Sethe nods and crosses to the table, to sit down. But as she sinks into the chair, Beloved kicks it away;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't sit with me!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, don't be like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't sit with me!! I don't sit with people who leave me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk like that. Your mama loves you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had another dream last night. (as she eats) The dead man laying on top of me and I had nothing to eat. And the ghosts without skin stuck their fingers in me and said Beloved in the dark and bitch in the light..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say those things. You forget about those dreams..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave me the bad dreams. You left me behind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama told you - I'd give up my own life, every minute, every hour of it to take back one of your tears baby...My children my best thing. You my best thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're weren't nice to me..you didn't smile at me..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true. I told you, I had to get you out, make you safe...so's you and me could be together on the other side, forever..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am... No one pays attention to Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Beloved flings her plate at Sethe, hitting her hard across the eye..the plate breaking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold back Denver - I'm fine..You..you go on upstairs. I'll do the cleaning up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But mama..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go upstairs I said!! Sethe's harsh tone is only for Denver. Denver exits the kitchen, afraid to leave them alone... As she moves from the kitchen, she hears;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want somethin' sweet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have nothing sweet no more, baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me, you don't! You don't let me eat the pies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Since mama lost her job, we don't have no more pies.. Denver walks up the white stairs... INT. BABY SUGGS' ROOM - DAY. Denver has straightened up her grandmother's room. Cleaned away the broken pieces of the lamp. Gathered the remnants of the quilt.. She holds the quilt as she sits on the bed, facing the headboard. SHE REMEMBERS: MEMORY: INT. BABY SUGGS' ROOM - A DAY REMEMBERED. Baby Suggs, near death, lying in her bed, chuckles and coughs;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean I never told you about your daddy? About the Bodwins who let me rent this here house while I do my shoe repairing? About your mother's feet, not to mention her back? I never told you all that? A NINE YEAR OLD DENVER shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that why you can't walk down the steps and out yonder by yourself? Denver can't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you never go back to Lady Jone's and learn your letters? You liked going there I remember. Seeing the other children. Then all a sudden, you stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a boy there...said mama was a jailbird...said he could prove it.. Baby Suggs face registers the pain of her granddaughter, hurt by hurtful words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Jesus my...What people won't say. Why didn't you come and ask me? (Denver shrugs) 'Fraid I'll tell ya, huh? (Denver looks at her) Come here, child.. Denver crawls into her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to go sometime. You got to go out there by yourself sometime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said...you said out there, there ain't no...what was that word?..no..de- fense. No de-fense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There ain't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what do I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know it, and go on out the yard. Go on. END OF MEMORY. INT. BABY SUGGS' ROOM - DAY. Denver has crawled up and snuggled against the pillow in the same position as when she was nine in her grandma's arms. INT. SECOND FLOOR LANDING - DAY. Denver has changed into a clean, pretty dress and is approaching the stairs when she passes Sethe's room. It's door is open. She looks in.. Sethe stands with her back to the door, cleaned up, wearing her best dress and the hat she last wore to the carnival. Denver smiles, hopefully;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama? Sethe turns, startled, to reveal - it is BELOVED in Sethe's best clothes...When Beloved sees Denver, she smiles tauntingly and strikes a pose...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I look just like her. Disgusted, Denver exits. INT. KITCHEN - DAY. Denver walks down the stairs, entering the kitchen; Sethe is on her knees, picking up pieces of broken plate. As she moves the skin on her knees bleeds as it scrapes against pieces too small to clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama let me help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !...She wanted me to do it. Sethe continues her work, without even looking at Denver. Denver pauses a moment, realizing she is of no use here - but knowing she needs to help her mother somehow. She looks up to the kitchen, where every cupboard door is open revealing empty shelves...SHE EXITS - HEADING FOR THE FRONT DOOR. INT. FRONT HALL - DAY. C.U. - FRONT DOOR. Denver's hands slowly reaches towards the door lock - and OPENS IT. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Denver opens the door, then pushes the broken screen door off it's hinge. She closes the door behind her. She begins her walk from the porch to the road. The first time she's ever gone alone..not knowing what she will face beyond the perimeters of her home. She reaches Bluestone Road and stops. She looks in either direction and sees not a soul. She takes a breath. She begins to walk - to get help. A block from the house, TWO BLACK MEN turn a corner and walk towards her. Denver stops, frightened, not knowing what to do. The TWO BLACK MEN pass her, tipping their hats, saying;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning...Morning.. And they walk by. Denver's eyes speak the gratitude she never got her mouth open in time to reply. Heartened by the encounter, she picks up speed. EXT. LADY JONES' HOUSE - DAY. LADY JONES - a light-skinned black woman with gray eyes and yellow woolly hair - opens the door to find Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Denver..Look at you. Denver manages to smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been so long. It's so nice of you to come see me. What brings you? Unfortunately, Denver can't manage anything beyond the smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, never mind - nobody needs a reason to visit. Let me make us some tea. Come on. Lady Jones takes her by the hand and leads her inside. INT. LADY JONES' HOUSE - DAY. Tea things sit on a table between them. Denver eats whatever she can. Lady Jones watches with care and concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's your family, honey? Denver swallows a bite of something with some tea, then;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to work, Miss Lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work? Start learnin your letters again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I mean work work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what can you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do anything but I would learn it for you if you have a little extra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Extra?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food. My mama, she doesn't feel well. I couldn't stay away from her too long, cause of her condition but I could do chores in the mornings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh baby...I don't know anyone could pay anybody anything for work they did themselves...But if you all need to eat until your mother's well, all you have to do is say so...We have a church committee invented so nobody had to go hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No..No that won't do... Lady Jones can sense something far more serious is going on. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD./ KITCHEN - DAY. Denver brings four eggs, some rice and some tea onto the kitchen table. Sethe's eyes well up. She looks at Denver as if for the first time. Her face an expression of gratitude. Suddenly;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RAAAIN!!! RAAAAIN! Sethe and Denver rush out of the kitchen to see; beloved running through the rooms, clawing at her throat, causing it to bleed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Sethe and Denver rush towards into the keeping room. Sethe stumbles over a chair to get to Beloved, kneeling on the floor, ripping at her own neck... Denver gets her from behind and Sethe grabs her from the front, pinning her down - trying to stop her from hurting herself. Beloved screams and strikes out at Sethe, pulling her hair, clawing at her as well... EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Denver exits the house because she sees something unusual in the yard; POV - THE STUMP; On the same stump that Beloved first appeared, sits A BASKET OF EGGS. Denver crosses to it, lifts it and a PAPER flutters to the ground. She reads it; M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS... EXT. M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS HOUSE - DAY. Denver returns the empty basket to M. Lucille Williams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS Your welcome.. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Beloved eats ravenously from a bowl of white beans. Sethe sits in the corner, as if waiting to serve her... EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY Upon the stump, sits a plate of cold rabbit meat, which Denver brings inside. INT. GRACE'S HOUSE - DAY. Denver is returning a bowl to Grace, a friendly woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, darling. That's not my bowl. Mine's got a blue ring around it..Would you like to come in a spell? INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Beloved sleeps curled up on the kitchen floor after eating - her mouth still dirty from the meal... Sethe, unwashed, her hair uncombed, sits in her corner chair. She is trying to mend a torn dress. Denver eats a little from the latest neighborhood gift. She hears her mother mumbling to herself like a madwoman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody..no sir..that's right..nobody's going be doing that..nobody going be writing my daughter's characteristics on the animal side..no sir..I don't care..ain't laying that down..no sir. I refuse..that's right..that's right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama...Mama she's asleep. Why don't you eat something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She likes this dress...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you'll hurt your eyes doin it there. Come sit at the table. Sethe considers this. She rises cautiously, then sits at the table. Denver rises and gets her some food, placing it before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please mama, eat something... Sethe nods...Denver is getting more and more frightened of losing her mother completely...Instead of protecting Beloved from Sethe, she must protect her mother from Beloved. EXT. THE BODWIN'S HOUSE; BACK DOOR - DAY. A white family home in a white Ohio neighborhood. JANEY WAGON, a benevolent black servant woman, opens the back door for Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to see Mr. and Mrs. Bodwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Bodwin. They brother and sister, darlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want'em for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for work. I was thinking they might know of some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You Baby Sugg's kin, ain't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard your mother took sick, that so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, come on in. You letting in flies. INT. THE BODWIN'S HOUSE - DAY. The house is filled with books and pearl white lamps and glass cases filled with glistening things. Denver pushes her feet into the soft blue carpet as she sits with Janey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I've been here since I was fourteen and I remember like yesterday when Baby Suggs, holy, came here and sat right where you are. Whiteman name of Garner brought her. He and Mr. Bodwin were good friends. That's how she got that house you all live in. Other things too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never went to those woodland services but she was always nice to me. Always. Never be another like her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bet you do. Everybody miss her. That was a good woman...Well, I don't know whether the Bodwins think it or not but they sure could use some extra help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They getting older now and I can't take care of 'em like I used to. More and more they keep asking me to sleep over night. Now, I don't want to quit these people but they can't have all my days and nights too. I got my own family needs me. It'll take some convincing but maybe you could come after supper - take care of your mama during the day, then earn a little something at night, how's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. But what would I do at night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be here. In case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case the house burn down or bad weather slops the roads so bad I can't get here on time or late guests needed cleaning up after. Anything. (laughs) Don't ask me what whitefolks need at night. During Janey's lines, Denver looks about the house imagining herself here at night...her eyes happen upon A STATUE OF A BLACK BOY on his knees, his head thrown back farther than a head could go, his mouth wide open like a cup and filled with money for delivery tips. On the pedestal are the words' AT YO SERVICE;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They good whitefolks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. They good. Can't say they ain't good. I wouldn't trade them for another pair, tell you that. But you come back in a few days - give me a chance to lead'em to it. All right? Denver nods, beaming gratefully - so gratefully that no words come, only tears... Janey reaches for Denver's hand and holds it warmly;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, child? What's the trouble with Sethe? Denver looks at her and we know she needs to tell someone. INT. ELLA'S HOUSE - DAY. Ella has gathered all the women of the town for a meeting including Lady Jones, Janey Wagon, M. Lucille Williams, Grace;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But is it really the daughter, Janey? The killed one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That what she say. M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS How they know it's her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's sitting there. Sleeps, eats and raises hell. Whipping Sethe every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be. A baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Grown now. The age it would have been had it lived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the flesh. And whipping her. M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS Guess she had it coming a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody got that coming. M. LUCILLE WILLIAMS But Ella- you can't just up and kill your children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, and the children can't just up and kill the mama. What's fair ain't necessarily right... (the women listen) Now you all know how I felt about the whole thing. I know the rage Sethe felt in that shed that day.  We all do. But what I could not understand, and still don't, was her reaction to it. Prideful. Too damn complicated for a black woman in her position before God. But whatever she done, I don't like the idea of past errors taking possession of the present. I don't cotton to sin moving in on a house, unleashed and sassy. Every day life takes enough, takes all a woman has. "Sufficient unto the day is evil thereof" and nobody needs more. Nobody needs a grown up evil sitting at a table with a grudge. As long as that ghost showed itself from a ghostly place, I respected it. But once it take on flesh and come into this world, well, the shoe's on the other foot now. I don't mind a little communication between worlds. But this here's an invasion. The women agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we pray?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. First. Then we got to get down to business. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD.: KITCHEN - DAYS LATER. Denver comes down the stairs, entering the kitchen. Sethe, worn out, looking more beaten and ravaged than before, stands at the sink with an ICE PICK chopping up ice. Denver speaks to her, but she does not turn or acknowledge her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama?....Mama I'm going out.. (no response) Mama, I got a job. Working over at the Bodwins at night. Mr. Bodwin coming over now to pick me up on his way back from town. I'll be staying there nights and coming back here for the daytime. We'll have some money, mama..Mama? Sethe continues her action as if hypnotized. Denver approaches her from behind and whispers softly;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going help you, mama. Don't you give up yet. Denver touches her gently, but Sethe acts as if she hears and feels nothing. Denver exits. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - LATE THAT DAY. Denver is sitting on the stump waiting for Mr. Bodwin when she hears; THIRTY WOMEN, gathered together, walking up Bluestone Rd. towards 124, SINGING A HOLY SONG; Denver is amazed by the sight as the women position themselves right in front of 124 - armed with bibles, crucifixes and whatever other symbols of heavenly power they could find. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD; THE KEEPING ROOM - DAY. Sethe is rubbing a naked Beloved's forehead with a cool cloth filled with ice, when the two women hear the singing. Beloved rises first and moves to the window to see. EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. The women continue singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. FURTHER DOWN BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. MR. BODWIN, sitting on a wagon pulled by a horse, is riding toward 124 when he hears the singing as well. WE NOTICE THAT MR. BODWIN IS WEARING A HAT SIMILAR TO THE ONE SCHOOLTEACHER WORE on that fateful day. CUT BACK TO: EXT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. The women continue singing as: Sethe and Beloved, her belly as big as a pregnant woman's, exit the house. The women are stunned by the sight and slightly confused by the lack of fear between the women. Sethe is holding Beloved's hand. Beloved is smiling brightly at the beautiful singing. Denver looks to her mother; Tears run down Sethe's face but she is not crying. The sound of the women's voices wash over her like a baptism. She looks to all the women, faces she remembers, faces she has missed although up until this moment was not conscious of missing. Then, Sethe looks beyond the women and sees: MR. BODWIN APPROACHING IN HIS WAGON. SHE SEES MR. BODWIN WEARING A HAT THAT LOOKS LIKE SCHOOLTEACHERS. Sethe's expression turns to fear, then rage. In her ravaged mind, she thinks it is Schoolteacher coming back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...No, he's not coming into my yard. He not taking my best thing...No.. She releases Beloved's hand and moves forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...no...no..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama? She passes Denver, feeling for the ICE PICK IN HER APRON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...NO..NO..NOOOOOOOOOOOO! As Mr. Bodwin reaches the thirty women who separate him from 124. HIS EYES FOCUS IN WONDER ON THE NAKED BELOVED AS; SETHE RUNS TOWARDS HIM AND THE WOMEN, HER HAND EXTENDED HOLDING THE ICE PICK..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...NOOOOOOO! DENVER RUNS AFTER HER. SETHE REACHES THE WOMEN AND LUNGES FOR BODWIN BUT THE WOMEN SEIZE HER, CREATING A HILL OF BLACK PEOPLE. SETHE RISING TO THE TOP, HER HAND EXTENDED. DENVER REACHING HER FROM BEHIND, PULLING HER BACK AND PUNCHING HER OUT COLD AS THE BODIES FALL AROUND THEM.... Beloved watches from the house - watches Sethe attack and defend with the ice pick.  And something within her is resolved. For a moment, we see a calm spirit instead of a wild animal. And a tear upon her face.. Then, just as quickly, she sprints around the side of the house and disappears from view. The Women try to help Sethe as Denver cries for her mother. Mr. Bodwin looks on stunned. WIDE ANGLE - OF A NAKED BLACK WOMAN WITH A FULL BELLY RUNNING THROUGH AN OPEN FIELD, REACHING THE WOODS THEN DISAPPEARING INTO THE TREES......
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; FADE IN: EXT. RICHMOND ST. - DAY. WEEKS LATER. Paul D. is on his way to work when he sees; A poised, confident Denver walking in the opposite direction. She spots him and smiles;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Paul D. Paul is clearly impressed by the sight of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, is it now? How you getting along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't pay to complain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You on your way home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Got me an afternoon job at the shirt factory. Figure between that and my night work at the Bodwins I might be able to put something away for me and mama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They treating you right over at the Bodwins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than all right. Miss Bodwin, she teach me stuff..Book stuff. She says I might go to Oberlin. She's experimenting on me. Paul smiles - wanting to warn her but deciding not to spoil the possibilities that lay before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not a bit all right. Hasn't gotten out of bed since that day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I should stop by? Think she'd welcome it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I think I've lost my mother, Paul D. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That girl...You know, Beloved...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gone like they say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't seen her since that day. Ella thinks she might be waiting in the woods for another chance but..I don't think so. Mama thinks she's gone for good. Says she can feel it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think she sure 'nough your sister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At times. At other times I think she was...more. But who would know that better than you. I mean, you sure 'nough you her. She levels her eyes at him and he knows what she means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if you want my opinion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't. I have my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You grown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, good luck with the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. They pass each other until Denver turns back;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Paul D...you don't have to stay 'way, but be careful how you talk to my mama, hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. Paul watches her walk away. He watches as a YOUNG BLACK MAN runs towards her shouting;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Miss Denver..Wait up! He watches as the two young people, the future, walk together. INT. 124 BLUESTONE RD. - DAY. Paul enters the house and hears HUMMING. He walks towards the keeping room, whose door is ajar; INT. KEEPING ROOM - DAY. Sethe lies in bed with the remnants of Baby Sugg's quilt over her, as she hums her melody and looks out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sethe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul D. She looks like she's dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, Sethe. He approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shaved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Look bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, You looking good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Devil's confusion. What's this I hear about you not getting out of bed? (no response) I saw Denver. She tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She comes in the daytime.  She still with me, my Denver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to get up from here, girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tired, Paul. So tired. I have to rest a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you die on me!! This is Baby Suggs quilt. Is that what you planning!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't have no plans. No plans at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look - Denver be here in the day. I be here in the night. I'm a take care of you, you hear? Starting now. Sethe looks at him - a long look - and sees in him that thing, that blessedness, "that makes him the kind of man who can walk into a house and make women cry, make women tell him things they could only tell each other".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She left me. She's gone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, girl. Don't cry...Me and you, we got more yesterday than anybody. We need some kind of tomorrow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was my best thing. Paul leans down and takes her hand, entwining his fingers into hers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You your best thing, Sethe. You are. Sethe smiles, with tears in her eyes, looking almost surprised;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?...Me? EXT. THE CLEARING - A DAY OUT OF TIME. A beautiful, sunny day. The clearing is full. Everyone looks bright and hopeful. Dressed in bright, summer clothes... A robust Baby Suggs is on her rock giving her best Call, as camera pans the crowd of faces eager to believe ....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..The only grace we can have, is the grace we can imagine. If you cannot see it, you will not have it...Here, in this place, we are flesh. Flesh that weeps, laughs, dances on bare feet in the grass. Love it. Love it hard. Yonder they do not love your flesh. They despise it. They flay it. O, my people, they do not love your hands. Those they only use, tie, bind, chop off and leave empty, Love your hands. Love them. Raise them up and kiss them. Touch others with them, put them together, stroke them on your face 'cause they don't love that either. You  got to love it. You. Yonder out there, they ain't in love with your moth. They will see it broken and break it again. What you say out of it, they will not heed. What you scream from it they do not hear. No, they don't love your mother. You got to love it. And the feet that need to rest and to dance. The backs that needs support. The shoulders that need arms, strong arms I'm telling you! O my people, out yonder they don't love your neck unnoosed and straight. So love your neck; put a hand on it, grace it, stroke it and hold it up. Love all your inside parts, love 'em..and the beating heart, love that too. More than eyes or feet. More than lungs that have yet to draw free air, love your heart. For this is the prize. And with her twisted, broken old body BABY SUGGS BEGINS TO DANCE AND TWIRL UP ON HER ROCK. And the crowd gives her music, SINGING IN FOUR PART HARMONY. CAMERA PANS THE CROWD OF BEAUTIFUL FACES singing together. Among the crowd, we see FAMILIAR FACES... WE SEE THE WOMEN WHO SANG AT 124... WE STAMP PAID, ELLA, JOHN, and LADY JONES... AND WE SEE SETHE, SURROUNDED BY ALL HER CHILDREN.
direction.name: direction
